00065 struct kmem_cache *ll_file_data_slab;
00066 
00067 #ifndef log2
00068 #define log2(n) ffz(~(n))
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 static struct ll_sb_info *ll_init_sbi(void)
00072 {
00073         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = NULL;
00074         unsigned long pages;
00075         unsigned long lru_page_max;
00076         struct sysinfo si;
00077         class_uuid_t uuid;
00078         int i;
00079         ENTRY;
00080 
00081         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(sbi);
00082         if (sbi == NULL)
00083                 RETURN(NULL);
00084 
00085         spin_lock_init(&sbi->ll_lock);
00086         mutex_init(&sbi->ll_lco.lco_lock);
00087         spin_lock_init(&sbi->ll_pp_extent_lock);
00088         spin_lock_init(&sbi->ll_process_lock);
00089         sbi->ll_rw_stats_on = 0;
00090 
00091         si_meminfo(&si);
00092         pages = si.totalram - si.totalhigh;
00093         lru_page_max = pages / 2;
00094 
00095         /* initialize ll_cache data */
00096         sbi->ll_cache = cl_cache_init(lru_page_max);
00097         if (sbi->ll_cache == NULL) {
00098                 OBD_FREE(sbi, sizeof(*sbi));
00099                 RETURN(NULL);
00100         }
00101 
00102         sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages_per_file = min(pages / 32,
00103                                            SBI_DEFAULT_READAHEAD_MAX);
00104         sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages = sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages_per_file;
00105         sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_read_ahead_whole_pages =
00106                                            SBI_DEFAULT_READAHEAD_WHOLE_MAX;
00107         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sbi->ll_conn_chain);
00108         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sbi->ll_orphan_dentry_list);
00109 
00110         ll_generate_random_uuid(uuid);
00111         class_uuid_unparse(uuid, &sbi->ll_sb_uuid);
00112         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "generated uuid: %s\n", sbi->ll_sb_uuid.uuid);
00113 
00114         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_VERBOSE;
00115 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKSUM
00116         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_CHECKSUM;
00117 #endif
00118 
00119 #ifdef HAVE_LRU_RESIZE_SUPPORT
00120         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_LRU_RESIZE;
00121 #endif
00122 
00123         for (i = 0; i <= LL_PROCESS_HIST_MAX; i++) {
00124                 spin_lock_init(&sbi->ll_rw_extents_info.pp_extents[i].
00125                                pp_r_hist.oh_lock);
00126                 spin_lock_init(&sbi->ll_rw_extents_info.pp_extents[i].
00127                                pp_w_hist.oh_lock);
00128         }
00129 
00130         /* metadata statahead is enabled by default */
00131         sbi->ll_sa_max = LL_SA_RPC_DEF;
00132         atomic_set(&sbi->ll_sa_total, 0);
00133         atomic_set(&sbi->ll_sa_wrong, 0);
00134         atomic_set(&sbi->ll_sa_running, 0);
00135         atomic_set(&sbi->ll_agl_total, 0);
00136         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_AGL_ENABLED;
00137 
00138         /* root squash */
00139         sbi->ll_squash.rsi_uid = 0;
00140         sbi->ll_squash.rsi_gid = 0;
00141         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sbi->ll_squash.rsi_nosquash_nids);
00142         init_rwsem(&sbi->ll_squash.rsi_sem);
00143 
00144         RETURN(sbi);
00145 }
00146 
00147 static void ll_free_sbi(struct super_block *sb)
00148 {
00149         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00150         ENTRY;
00151 
00152         if (sbi != NULL) {
00153                 if (!list_empty(&sbi->ll_squash.rsi_nosquash_nids))
00154                         cfs_free_nidlist(&sbi->ll_squash.rsi_nosquash_nids);
00155                 if (sbi->ll_cache != NULL) {
00156                         cl_cache_decref(sbi->ll_cache);
00157                         sbi->ll_cache = NULL;
00158                 }
00159                 OBD_FREE(sbi, sizeof(*sbi));
00160         }
00161         EXIT;
00162 }
00163 
00164 static int client_common_fill_super(struct super_block *sb, char *md, char *dt,
00165                                     struct vfsmount *mnt)
00166 {
00167         struct inode *root = NULL;
00168         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00169         struct obd_device *obd;
00170         struct obd_statfs *osfs = NULL;
00171         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
00172         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00173         struct obd_uuid *uuid;
00174         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00175         struct lustre_md lmd;
00176         u64 valid;
00177         int size, err, checksum;
00178         ENTRY;
00179 
00180         obd = class_name2obd(md);
00181         if (!obd) {
00182                 CERROR("MD %s: not setup or attached\n", md);
00183                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00184         }
00185 
00186         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00187         if (data == NULL)
00188                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00189 
00190         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osfs);
00191         if (osfs == NULL) {
00192                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00193                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00194         }
00195 
00196         /* indicate the features supported by this client */
00197         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_IBITS    | OBD_CONNECT_NODEVOH  |
00198                                   OBD_CONNECT_ATTRFID  |
00199                                   OBD_CONNECT_VERSION  | OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE |
00200                                   OBD_CONNECT_MDS_CAPA | OBD_CONNECT_OSS_CAPA |
00201                                   OBD_CONNECT_CANCELSET | OBD_CONNECT_FID     |
00202                                   OBD_CONNECT_AT       | OBD_CONNECT_LOV_V3   |
00203                                   OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT | OBD_CONNECT_VBR    |
00204                                   OBD_CONNECT_FULL20   | OBD_CONNECT_64BITHASH|
00205                                   OBD_CONNECT_EINPROGRESS |
00206                                   OBD_CONNECT_JOBSTATS | OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE |
00207                                   OBD_CONNECT_LAYOUTLOCK | OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS |
00208                                   OBD_CONNECT_MAX_EASIZE |
00209                                   OBD_CONNECT_FLOCK_DEAD |
00210                                   OBD_CONNECT_DISP_STRIPE | OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK |
00211                                   OBD_CONNECT_OPEN_BY_FID |
00212                                   OBD_CONNECT_DIR_STRIPE |
00213                                   OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS |
00214                                   OBD_CONNECT_SUBTREE;
00215 
00216 #ifdef HAVE_LRU_RESIZE_SUPPORT
00217         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_LRU_RESIZE)
00218                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_LRU_RESIZE;
00219 #endif
00220 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00221         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_ACL | OBD_CONNECT_UMASK;
00222 #endif
00223 
00224         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDC_LIGHTWEIGHT))
00225                 /* flag mdc connection as lightweight, only used for test
00226                  * purpose, use with care */
00227                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT;
00228 
00229         data->ocd_ibits_known = MDS_INODELOCK_FULL;
00230         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00231 
00232         if (sb->s_flags & MS_RDONLY)
00233                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY;
00234         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_XATTR)
00235                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_XATTR;
00236 
00237         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_FLOCK)
00238                 sbi->ll_fop = &ll_file_operations_flock;
00239         else if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_LOCALFLOCK)
00240                 sbi->ll_fop = &ll_file_operations;
00241         else
00242                 sbi->ll_fop = &ll_file_operations_noflock;
00243 
00244         /* real client */
00245         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_REAL;
00246         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)
00247                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT_FORCE;
00248 
00249         /* always ping even if server suppress_pings */
00250         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_ALWAYS_PING)
00251                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS;
00252 
00253         data->ocd_brw_size = MD_MAX_BRW_SIZE;
00254 
00255         err = obd_connect(NULL, &sbi->ll_md_exp, obd, &sbi->ll_sb_uuid, data, NULL);
00256         if (err == -EBUSY) {
00257                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x14f, "An MDT (md %s) is performing "
00258                                    "recovery, of which this client is not a "
00259                                    "part. Please wait for recovery to complete,"
00260                                    " abort, or time out.\n", md);
00261                 GOTO(out, err);
00262         } else if (err) {
00263                 CERROR("cannot connect to %s: rc = %d\n", md, err);
00264                 GOTO(out, err);
00265         }
00266 
00267         sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_connect_data = *data;
00268 
00269         err = obd_fid_init(sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd, sbi->ll_md_exp,
00270                            LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA);
00271         if (err) {
00272                 CERROR("%s: Can't init metadata layer FID infrastructure, "
00273                        "rc = %d\n", sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, err);
00274                 GOTO(out_md, err);
00275         }
00276 
00277         /* For mount, we only need fs info from MDT0, and also in DNE, it
00278          * can make sure the client can be mounted as long as MDT0 is
00279          * avaible */
00280         err = obd_statfs(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp, osfs,
00281                         cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
00282                         OBD_STATFS_FOR_MDT0);
00283         if (err)
00284                 GOTO(out_md_fid, err);
00285 
00286         /* This needs to be after statfs to ensure connect has finished.
00287          * Note that "data" does NOT contain the valid connect reply.
00288          * If connecting to a 1.8 server there will be no LMV device, so
00289          * we can access the MDC export directly and exp_connect_flags will
00290          * be non-zero, but if accessing an upgraded 2.1 server it will
00291          * have the correct flags filled in.
00292          * XXX: fill in the LMV exp_connect_flags from MDC(s). */
00293         valid = exp_connect_flags(sbi->ll_md_exp) & CLIENT_CONNECT_MDT_REQD;
00294         if (exp_connect_flags(sbi->ll_md_exp) != 0 &&
00295             valid != CLIENT_CONNECT_MDT_REQD) {
00296                 char *buf;
00297 
00298                 OBD_ALLOC_WAIT(buf, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00299                 obd_connect_flags2str(buf, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE,
00300                                       valid ^ CLIENT_CONNECT_MDT_REQD, ",");
00301                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x170, "Server %s does not support "
00302                                    "feature(s) needed for correct operation "
00303                                    "of this client (%s). Please upgrade "
00304                                    "server or downgrade client.\n",
00305                                    sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, buf);
00306                 OBD_FREE(buf, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00307                 GOTO(out_md_fid, err = -EPROTO);
00308         }
00309 
00310         size = sizeof(*data);
00311         err = obd_get_info(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(KEY_CONN_DATA),
00312                            KEY_CONN_DATA,  &size, data);
00313         if (err) {
00314                 CERROR("%s: Get connect data failed: rc = %d\n",
00315                        sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, err);
00316                 GOTO(out_md_fid, err);
00317         }
00318 
00319         LASSERT(osfs->os_bsize);
00320         sb->s_blocksize = osfs->os_bsize;
00321         sb->s_blocksize_bits = log2(osfs->os_bsize);
00322         sb->s_magic = LL_SUPER_MAGIC;
00323         sb->s_maxbytes = MAX_LFS_FILESIZE;
00324         sbi->ll_namelen = osfs->os_namelen;
00325 
00326         if ((sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_XATTR) &&
00327             !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_XATTR)) {
00328                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Disabling user_xattr feature because "
00329                               "it is not supported on the server\n");
00330                 sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_USER_XATTR;
00331         }
00332 
00333         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_ACL) {
00334 #ifdef MS_POSIXACL
00335                 sb->s_flags |= MS_POSIXACL;
00336 #endif
00337                 sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_ACL;
00338         } else {
00339                 LCONSOLE_INFO("client wants to enable acl, but mdt not!\n");
00340 #ifdef MS_POSIXACL
00341                 sb->s_flags &= ~MS_POSIXACL;
00342 #endif
00343                 sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_ACL;
00344         }
00345 
00346         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT) {
00347                 if (!(sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)) {
00348                         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT;
00349                         LCONSOLE_INFO("client is set as remote by default.\n");
00350                 }
00351         } else {
00352                 if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT) {
00353                         sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT;
00354                         LCONSOLE_INFO("client claims to be remote, but server "
00355                                       "rejected, forced to be local.\n");
00356                 }
00357         }
00358 
00359         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_64BITHASH)
00360                 sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_64BIT_HASH;
00361 
00362         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE)
00363                 sbi->ll_md_brw_pages = data->ocd_brw_size >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00364         else
00365                 sbi->ll_md_brw_pages = 1;
00366 
00367         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LAYOUTLOCK)
00368                 sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_LAYOUT_LOCK;
00369 
00370         if (data->ocd_ibits_known & MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR) {
00371                 if (!(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MAX_EASIZE)) {
00372                         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: disabling xattr cache due to "
00373                                       "unknown maximum xattr size.\n", dt);
00374                 } else {
00375                         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_XATTR_CACHE;
00376                         sbi->ll_xattr_cache_enabled = 1;
00377                 }
00378         }
00379 
00380         obd = class_name2obd(dt);
00381         if (!obd) {
00382                 CERROR("DT %s: not setup or attached\n", dt);
00383                 GOTO(out_md_fid, err = -ENODEV);
00384         }
00385 
00386         /* pass client page size via ocd_grant_blkbits, the server should report
00387          * back its backend blocksize for grant calculation purpose */
00388         data->ocd_grant_blkbits = PAGE_SHIFT;
00389 
00390         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_GRANT     | OBD_CONNECT_VERSION  |
00391                                   OBD_CONNECT_REQPORTAL | OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE |
00392                                   OBD_CONNECT_CANCELSET | OBD_CONNECT_FID      |
00393                                   OBD_CONNECT_SRVLOCK   | OBD_CONNECT_TRUNCLOCK|
00394                                   OBD_CONNECT_AT | OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT |
00395                                   OBD_CONNECT_OSS_CAPA | OBD_CONNECT_VBR|
00396                                   OBD_CONNECT_FULL20 | OBD_CONNECT_64BITHASH |
00397                                   OBD_CONNECT_MAXBYTES |
00398                                   OBD_CONNECT_EINPROGRESS |
00399                                   OBD_CONNECT_JOBSTATS | OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE |
00400                                   OBD_CONNECT_LAYOUTLOCK |
00401                                   OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS | OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK |
00402                                   OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS;
00403 
00404         if (!OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM))
00405                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM;
00406 
00407         if (!OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CONNECT_CKSUM)) {
00408                 /* OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM should always be set, even if checksums are
00409                  * disabled by default, because it can still be enabled on the
00410                  * fly via /proc. As a consequence, we still need to come to an
00411                  * agreement on the supported algorithms at connect time */
00412                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM;
00413 
00414                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CKSUM_ADLER_ONLY))
00415                         data->ocd_cksum_types = OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00416                 else
00417                         data->ocd_cksum_types = cksum_types_supported_client();
00418         }
00419 
00420 #ifdef HAVE_LRU_RESIZE_SUPPORT
00421         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_LRU_RESIZE;
00422 #endif
00423         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)
00424                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT_FORCE;
00425 
00426         /* always ping even if server suppress_pings */
00427         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_ALWAYS_PING)
00428                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS;
00429 
00430         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "ocd_connect_flags: "LPX64" ocd_version: %d "
00431                "ocd_grant: %d\n", data->ocd_connect_flags,
00432                data->ocd_version, data->ocd_grant);
00433 
00434         obd->obd_upcall.onu_owner = &sbi->ll_lco;
00435         obd->obd_upcall.onu_upcall = cl_ocd_update;
00436 
00437         data->ocd_brw_size = DT_MAX_BRW_SIZE;
00438 
00439         err = obd_connect(NULL, &sbi->ll_dt_exp, obd, &sbi->ll_sb_uuid, data,
00440                           NULL);
00441         if (err == -EBUSY) {
00442                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x150, "An OST (dt %s) is performing "
00443                                    "recovery, of which this client is not a "
00444                                    "part.  Please wait for recovery to "
00445                                    "complete, abort, or time out.\n", dt);
00446                 GOTO(out_md, err);
00447         } else if (err) {
00448                 CERROR("%s: Cannot connect to %s: rc = %d\n",
00449                        sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, dt, err);
00450                 GOTO(out_md, err);
00451         }
00452 
00453         sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_connect_data = *data;
00454 
00455         err = obd_fid_init(sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
00456                            LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA);
00457         if (err) {
00458                 CERROR("%s: Can't init data layer FID infrastructure, "
00459                        "rc = %d\n", sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, err);
00460                 GOTO(out_dt, err);
00461         }
00462 
00463         mutex_lock(&sbi->ll_lco.lco_lock);
00464         sbi->ll_lco.lco_flags = data->ocd_connect_flags;
00465         sbi->ll_lco.lco_md_exp = sbi->ll_md_exp;
00466         sbi->ll_lco.lco_dt_exp = sbi->ll_dt_exp;
00467         mutex_unlock(&sbi->ll_lco.lco_lock);
00468 
00469         fid_zero(&sbi->ll_root_fid);
00470         err = md_get_root(sbi->ll_md_exp, get_mount_fileset(sb),
00471                            &sbi->ll_root_fid);
00472         if (err) {
00473                 CERROR("cannot mds_connect: rc = %d\n", err);
00474                 GOTO(out_lock_cn_cb, err);
00475         }
00476         if (!fid_is_sane(&sbi->ll_root_fid)) {
00477                 CERROR("%s: Invalid root fid "DFID" during mount\n",
00478                        sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name,
00479                        PFID(&sbi->ll_root_fid));
00480                 GOTO(out_lock_cn_cb, err = -EINVAL);
00481         }
00482         CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "rootfid "DFID"\n", PFID(&sbi->ll_root_fid));
00483 
00484         sb->s_op = &lustre_super_operations;
00485 #if THREAD_SIZE >= 8192 /*b=17630*/
00486         sb->s_export_op = &lustre_export_operations;
00487 #endif
00488 
00489         /* make root inode
00490          * XXX: move this to after cbd setup? */
00491         valid = OBD_MD_FLGETATTR | OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS | OBD_MD_FLMODEASIZE;
00492         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)
00493                 valid |= OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM;
00494         else if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_ACL)
00495                 valid |= OBD_MD_FLACL;
00496 
00497         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
00498         if (op_data == NULL)
00499                 GOTO(out_lock_cn_cb, err = -ENOMEM);
00500 
00501         op_data->op_fid1 = sbi->ll_root_fid;
00502         op_data->op_mode = 0;
00503         op_data->op_valid = valid;
00504 
00505         err = md_getattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &request);
00506 
00507         OBD_FREE_PTR(op_data);
00508         if (err) {
00509                 CERROR("%s: md_getattr failed for root: rc = %d\n",
00510                        sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, err);
00511                 GOTO(out_lock_cn_cb, err);
00512         }
00513 
00514         err = md_get_lustre_md(sbi->ll_md_exp, request, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
00515                                sbi->ll_md_exp, &lmd);
00516         if (err) {
00517                 CERROR("failed to understand root inode md: rc = %d\n", err);
00518                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
00519                 GOTO(out_lock_cn_cb, err);
00520         }
00521 
00522         LASSERT(fid_is_sane(&sbi->ll_root_fid));
00523         root = ll_iget(sb, cl_fid_build_ino(&sbi->ll_root_fid,
00524                                             sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_32BIT_API),
00525                        &lmd);
00526         md_free_lustre_md(sbi->ll_md_exp, &lmd);
00527         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
00528 
00529         if (IS_ERR(root)) {
00530 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00531                 if (lmd.posix_acl) {
00532                         posix_acl_release(lmd.posix_acl);
00533                         lmd.posix_acl = NULL;
00534                 }
00535 #endif
00536                 err = IS_ERR(root) ? PTR_ERR(root) : -EBADF;
00537                 root = NULL;
00538                 CERROR("lustre_lite: bad iget4 for root\n");
00539                 GOTO(out_root, err);
00540         }
00541 
00542 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00543         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT) {
00544                 rct_init(&sbi->ll_rct);
00545                 et_init(&sbi->ll_et);
00546         }
00547 #endif
00548 
00549         checksum = sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_CHECKSUM;
00550         err = obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_dt_exp, sizeof(KEY_CHECKSUM),
00551                                  KEY_CHECKSUM, sizeof(checksum), &checksum,
00552                                  NULL);
00553         cl_sb_init(sb);
00554 
00555         err = obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_dt_exp, sizeof(KEY_CACHE_SET),
00556                                  KEY_CACHE_SET, sizeof(*sbi->ll_cache),
00557                                  sbi->ll_cache, NULL);
00558 
00559         sb->s_root = d_make_root(root);
00560         if (sb->s_root == NULL) {
00561                 CERROR("%s: can't make root dentry\n",
00562                         ll_get_fsname(sb, NULL, 0));
00563                 GOTO(out_root, err = -ENOMEM);
00564         }
00565 #ifdef HAVE_DCACHE_LOCK
00566         sb->s_root->d_op = &ll_d_ops;
00567 #endif
00568 
00569         sbi->ll_sdev_orig = sb->s_dev;
00570 
00571         /* We set sb->s_dev equal on all lustre clients in order to support
00572          * NFS export clustering.  NFSD requires that the FSID be the same
00573          * on all clients. */
00574         /* s_dev is also used in lt_compare() to compare two fs, but that is
00575          * only a node-local comparison. */
00576         uuid = obd_get_uuid(sbi->ll_md_exp);
00577         if (uuid != NULL)
00578                 sb->s_dev = get_uuid2int(uuid->uuid, strlen(uuid->uuid));
00579 
00580         if (data != NULL)
00581                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00582         if (osfs != NULL)
00583                 OBD_FREE_PTR(osfs);
00584         if (proc_lustre_fs_root != NULL) {
00585                 err = lprocfs_register_mountpoint(proc_lustre_fs_root, sb,
00586                                                   dt, md);
00587                 if (err < 0) {
00588                         CERROR("%s: could not register mount in lprocfs: "
00589                                "rc = %d\n", ll_get_fsname(sb, NULL, 0), err);
00590                         err = 0;
00591                 }
00592         }
00593 
00594         RETURN(err);
00595 out_root:
00596         if (root)
00597                 iput(root);
00598 out_lock_cn_cb:
00599         obd_fid_fini(sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd);
00600 out_dt:
00601         obd_disconnect(sbi->ll_dt_exp);
00602         sbi->ll_dt_exp = NULL;
00603 out_md_fid:
00604         obd_fid_fini(sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd);
00605 out_md:
00606         obd_disconnect(sbi->ll_md_exp);
00607         sbi->ll_md_exp = NULL;
00608 out:
00609         if (data != NULL)
00610                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00611         if (osfs != NULL)
00612                 OBD_FREE_PTR(osfs);
00613         return err;
00614 }
00615 
00616 int ll_get_max_mdsize(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, int *lmmsize)
00617 {
00618         int size, rc;
00619 
00620         size = sizeof(*lmmsize);
00621         rc = obd_get_info(NULL, sbi->ll_dt_exp, sizeof(KEY_MAX_EASIZE),
00622                           KEY_MAX_EASIZE, &size, lmmsize);
00623         if (rc != 0) {
00624                 CERROR("%s: cannot get max LOV EA size: rc = %d\n",
00625                        sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
00626                 RETURN(rc);
00627         }
00628 
00629         size = sizeof(int);
00630         rc = obd_get_info(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(KEY_MAX_EASIZE),
00631                           KEY_MAX_EASIZE, &size, lmmsize);
00632         if (rc)
00633                 CERROR("Get max mdsize error rc %d\n", rc);
00634 
00635         RETURN(rc);
00636 }
00637 
00649 int ll_get_default_mdsize(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, int *lmmsize)
00650 {
00651         int size, rc;
00652 
00653         size = sizeof(int);
00654         rc = obd_get_info(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE),
00655                          KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE, &size, lmmsize);
00656         if (rc)
00657                 CERROR("Get default mdsize error rc %d\n", rc);
00658 
00659         RETURN(rc);
00660 }
00661 
00673 int ll_set_default_mdsize(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, int lmmsize)
00674 {
00675         int rc;
00676 
00677         if (lmmsize < sizeof(struct lov_mds_md) ||
00678             lmmsize > OBD_MAX_DEFAULT_EA_SIZE)
00679                 return -EINVAL;
00680 
00681         rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp,
00682                                 sizeof(KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE), KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE,
00683                                 sizeof(int), &lmmsize, NULL);
00684 
00685         RETURN(rc);
00686 }
00687 
00688 static void ll_dump_inode(struct inode *inode)
00689 {
00690         struct ll_d_hlist_node *tmp;
00691         int dentry_count = 0;
00692 
00693         LASSERT(inode != NULL);
00694 
00695         ll_d_hlist_for_each(tmp, &inode->i_dentry)
00696                 dentry_count++;
00697 
00698         CERROR("%s: inode %p dump: dev=%s fid="DFID
00699                " mode=%o count=%u, %d dentries\n",
00700                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), inode,
00701                ll_i2mdexp(inode)->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
00702                inode->i_mode, atomic_read(&inode->i_count), dentry_count);
00703 }
00704 
00705 void lustre_dump_dentry(struct dentry *dentry, int recur)
00706 {
00707         struct list_head *tmp;
00708         int subdirs = 0;
00709 
00710         LASSERT(dentry != NULL);
00711 
00712         list_for_each(tmp, &dentry->d_subdirs)
00713                 subdirs++;
00714 
00715         CERROR("dentry %p dump: name=%.*s parent=%.*s (%p), inode=%p, count=%u,"
00716                " flags=0x%x, fsdata=%p, %d subdirs\n", dentry,
00717                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name,
00718                dentry->d_parent->d_name.len, dentry->d_parent->d_name.name,
00719                dentry->d_parent, dentry->d_inode, ll_d_count(dentry),
00720                dentry->d_flags, dentry->d_fsdata, subdirs);
00721         if (dentry->d_inode != NULL)
00722                 ll_dump_inode(dentry->d_inode);
00723 
00724         if (recur == 0)
00725                 return;
00726 
00727         list_for_each(tmp, &dentry->d_subdirs) {
00728                 struct dentry *d = list_entry(tmp, struct dentry, d_child);
00729                 lustre_dump_dentry(d, recur - 1);
00730         }
00731 }
00732 
00733 static void client_common_put_super(struct super_block *sb)
00734 {
00735         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00736         ENTRY;
00737 
00738 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00739         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT) {
00740                 et_fini(&sbi->ll_et);
00741                 rct_fini(&sbi->ll_rct);
00742         }
00743 #endif
00744 
00745         cl_sb_fini(sb);
00746 
00747         list_del(&sbi->ll_conn_chain);
00748 
00749         obd_fid_fini(sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_obd);
00750         obd_disconnect(sbi->ll_dt_exp);
00751         sbi->ll_dt_exp = NULL;
00752 
00753         lprocfs_unregister_mountpoint(sbi);
00754 
00755         obd_fid_fini(sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd);
00756         obd_disconnect(sbi->ll_md_exp);
00757         sbi->ll_md_exp = NULL;
00758 
00759         EXIT;
00760 }
00761 
00762 void ll_kill_super(struct super_block *sb)
00763 {
00764         struct ll_sb_info *sbi;
00765         ENTRY;
00766 
00767         /* not init sb ?*/
00768         if (!(sb->s_flags & MS_ACTIVE))
00769                 return;
00770 
00771         sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00772         /* we need restore s_dev from changed for clustred NFS before put_super
00773          * because new kernels have cached s_dev and change sb->s_dev in
00774          * put_super not affected real removing devices */
00775         if (sbi) {
00776                 sb->s_dev = sbi->ll_sdev_orig;
00777                 sbi->ll_umounting = 1;
00778 
00779                 /* wait running statahead threads to quit */
00780                 while (atomic_read(&sbi->ll_sa_running) > 0) {
00781                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00782                         schedule_timeout(msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC >> 3));
00783                 }
00784         }
00785 
00786         EXIT;
00787 }
00788 
00789 static inline int ll_set_opt(const char *opt, char *data, int fl)
00790 {
00791         if (strncmp(opt, data, strlen(opt)) != 0)
00792                 return(0);
00793         else
00794                 return(fl);
00795 }
00796 
00797 /* non-client-specific mount options are parsed in lmd_parse */
00798 static int ll_options(char *options, int *flags)
00799 {
00800         int tmp;
00801         char *s1 = options, *s2;
00802         ENTRY;
00803 
00804         if (!options)
00805                 RETURN(0);
00806 
00807         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Parsing opts %s\n", options);
00808 
00809         while (*s1) {
00810                 CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "next opt=%s\n", s1);
00811                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nolock", s1, LL_SBI_NOLCK);
00812                 if (tmp) {
00813                         *flags |= tmp;
00814                         goto next;
00815                 }
00816                 tmp = ll_set_opt("flock", s1, LL_SBI_FLOCK);
00817                 if (tmp) {
00818                         *flags |= tmp;
00819                         goto next;
00820                 }
00821                 tmp = ll_set_opt("localflock", s1, LL_SBI_LOCALFLOCK);
00822                 if (tmp) {
00823                         *flags |= tmp;
00824                         goto next;
00825                 }
00826                 tmp = ll_set_opt("noflock", s1, LL_SBI_FLOCK|LL_SBI_LOCALFLOCK);
00827                 if (tmp) {
00828                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00829                         goto next;
00830                 }
00831                 tmp = ll_set_opt("user_xattr", s1, LL_SBI_USER_XATTR);
00832                 if (tmp) {
00833                         *flags |= tmp;
00834                         goto next;
00835                 }
00836                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nouser_xattr", s1, LL_SBI_USER_XATTR);
00837                 if (tmp) {
00838                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00839                         goto next;
00840                 }
00841                 tmp = ll_set_opt("context", s1, 1);
00842                 if (tmp)
00843                         goto next;
00844                 tmp = ll_set_opt("fscontext", s1, 1);
00845                 if (tmp)
00846                         goto next;
00847                 tmp = ll_set_opt("defcontext", s1, 1);
00848                 if (tmp)
00849                         goto next;
00850                 tmp = ll_set_opt("rootcontext", s1, 1);
00851                 if (tmp)
00852                         goto next;
00853                 tmp = ll_set_opt("remote_client", s1, LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT);
00854                 if (tmp) {
00855                         *flags |= tmp;
00856                         goto next;
00857                 }
00858                 tmp = ll_set_opt("user_fid2path", s1, LL_SBI_USER_FID2PATH);
00859                 if (tmp) {
00860                         *flags |= tmp;
00861                         goto next;
00862                 }
00863                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nouser_fid2path", s1, LL_SBI_USER_FID2PATH);
00864                 if (tmp) {
00865                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00866                         goto next;
00867                 }
00868 
00869                 tmp = ll_set_opt("checksum", s1, LL_SBI_CHECKSUM);
00870                 if (tmp) {
00871                         *flags |= tmp;
00872                         goto next;
00873                 }
00874                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nochecksum", s1, LL_SBI_CHECKSUM);
00875                 if (tmp) {
00876                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00877                         goto next;
00878                 }
00879                 tmp = ll_set_opt("lruresize", s1, LL_SBI_LRU_RESIZE);
00880                 if (tmp) {
00881                         *flags |= tmp;
00882                         goto next;
00883                 }
00884                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nolruresize", s1, LL_SBI_LRU_RESIZE);
00885                 if (tmp) {
00886                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00887                         goto next;
00888                 }
00889                 tmp = ll_set_opt("lazystatfs", s1, LL_SBI_LAZYSTATFS);
00890                 if (tmp) {
00891                         *flags |= tmp;
00892                         goto next;
00893                 }
00894                 tmp = ll_set_opt("nolazystatfs", s1, LL_SBI_LAZYSTATFS);
00895                 if (tmp) {
00896                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00897                         goto next;
00898                 }
00899                 tmp = ll_set_opt("32bitapi", s1, LL_SBI_32BIT_API);
00900                 if (tmp) {
00901                         *flags |= tmp;
00902                         goto next;
00903                 }
00904                 tmp = ll_set_opt("verbose", s1, LL_SBI_VERBOSE);
00905                 if (tmp) {
00906                         *flags |= tmp;
00907                         goto next;
00908                 }
00909                 tmp = ll_set_opt("noverbose", s1, LL_SBI_VERBOSE);
00910                 if (tmp) {
00911                         *flags &= ~tmp;
00912                         goto next;
00913                 }
00914                 tmp = ll_set_opt("always_ping", s1, LL_SBI_ALWAYS_PING);
00915                 if (tmp) {
00916                         *flags |= tmp;
00917                         goto next;
00918                 }
00919                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x152, "Unknown option '%s', won't mount.\n",
00920                                    s1);
00921                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00922 
00923 next:
00924                 /* Find next opt */
00925                 s2 = strchr(s1, ',');
00926                 if (s2 == NULL)
00927                         break;
00928                 s1 = s2 + 1;
00929         }
00930         RETURN(0);
00931 }
00932 
00933 void ll_lli_init(struct ll_inode_info *lli)
00934 {
00935         lli->lli_inode_magic = LLI_INODE_MAGIC;
00936         lli->lli_flags = 0;
00937         spin_lock_init(&lli->lli_lock);
00938         lli->lli_posix_acl = NULL;
00939         lli->lli_remote_perms = NULL;
00940         mutex_init(&lli->lli_rmtperm_mutex);
00941         /* Do not set lli_fid, it has been initialized already. */
00942         fid_zero(&lli->lli_pfid);
00943         atomic_set(&lli->lli_open_count, 0);
00944         lli->lli_rmtperm_time = 0;
00945         lli->lli_mds_read_och = NULL;
00946         lli->lli_mds_write_och = NULL;
00947         lli->lli_mds_exec_och = NULL;
00948         lli->lli_open_fd_read_count = 0;
00949         lli->lli_open_fd_write_count = 0;
00950         lli->lli_open_fd_exec_count = 0;
00951         mutex_init(&lli->lli_och_mutex);
00952         spin_lock_init(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
00953         spin_lock_init(&lli->lli_layout_lock);
00954         ll_layout_version_set(lli, CL_LAYOUT_GEN_NONE);
00955         lli->lli_clob = NULL;
00956 
00957         init_rwsem(&lli->lli_xattrs_list_rwsem);
00958         mutex_init(&lli->lli_xattrs_enq_lock);
00959 
00960         LASSERT(lli->lli_vfs_inode.i_mode != 0);
00961         if (S_ISDIR(lli->lli_vfs_inode.i_mode)) {
00962                 mutex_init(&lli->lli_readdir_mutex);
00963                 lli->lli_opendir_key = NULL;
00964                 lli->lli_sai = NULL;
00965                 spin_lock_init(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00966                 lli->lli_opendir_pid = 0;
00967                 lli->lli_sa_enabled = 0;
00968                 lli->lli_def_stripe_offset = -1;
00969         } else {
00970                 mutex_init(&lli->lli_size_mutex);
00971                 lli->lli_symlink_name = NULL;
00972                 init_rwsem(&lli->lli_trunc_sem);
00973                 range_lock_tree_init(&lli->lli_write_tree);
00974                 init_rwsem(&lli->lli_glimpse_sem);
00975                 lli->lli_glimpse_time = 0;
00976                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lli->lli_agl_list);
00977                 lli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00978                 lli->lli_async_rc = 0;
00979         }
00980         mutex_init(&lli->lli_layout_mutex);
00981 }
00982 
00983 static inline int ll_bdi_register(struct backing_dev_info *bdi)
00984 {
00985         static atomic_t ll_bdi_num = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00986 
00987         bdi->name = "lustre";
00988         return bdi_register(bdi, NULL, "lustre-%d",
00989                             atomic_inc_return(&ll_bdi_num));
00990 }
00991 
00992 int ll_fill_super(struct super_block *sb, struct vfsmount *mnt)
00993 {
00994         struct lustre_profile *lprof = NULL;
00995         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00996         struct ll_sb_info *sbi;
00997         char  *dt = NULL, *md = NULL;
00998         char  *profilenm = get_profile_name(sb);
00999         struct config_llog_instance *cfg;
01000         /* %p for void* in printf needs 16+2 characters: 0xffffffffffffffff */
01001         const int instlen = sizeof(cfg->cfg_instance) * 2 + 2;
01002         int    err;
01003         ENTRY;
01004 
01005         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: sb %p\n", sb);
01006 
01007         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(cfg);
01008         if (cfg == NULL)
01009                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01010 
01011         try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
01012 
01013         /* client additional sb info */
01014         lsi->lsi_llsbi = sbi = ll_init_sbi();
01015         if (!sbi) {
01016                 module_put(THIS_MODULE);
01017                 OBD_FREE_PTR(cfg);
01018                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01019         }
01020 
01021         err = ll_options(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_opts, &sbi->ll_flags);
01022         if (err)
01023                 GOTO(out_free, err);
01024 
01025         err = bdi_init(&lsi->lsi_bdi);
01026         if (err)
01027                 GOTO(out_free, err);
01028         lsi->lsi_flags |= LSI_BDI_INITIALIZED;
01029 #ifdef HAVE_BDI_CAP_MAP_COPY
01030         lsi->lsi_bdi.capabilities = BDI_CAP_MAP_COPY;
01031 #else
01032         lsi->lsi_bdi.capabilities = 0;
01033 #endif
01034         err = ll_bdi_register(&lsi->lsi_bdi);
01035         if (err)
01036                 GOTO(out_free, err);
01037 
01038         sb->s_bdi = &lsi->lsi_bdi;
01039 #ifndef HAVE_DCACHE_LOCK
01040         /* kernel >= 2.6.38 store dentry operations in sb->s_d_op. */
01041         sb->s_d_op = &ll_d_ops;
01042 #endif
01043 
01044         /* Generate a string unique to this super, in case some joker tries
01045            to mount the same fs at two mount points.
01046            Use the address of the super itself.*/
01047         cfg->cfg_instance = sb;
01048         cfg->cfg_uuid = lsi->lsi_llsbi->ll_sb_uuid;
01049         cfg->cfg_callback = class_config_llog_handler;
01050         /* set up client obds */
01051         err = lustre_process_log(sb, profilenm, cfg);
01052         if (err < 0)
01053                 GOTO(out_free, err);
01054 
01055         /* Profile set with LCFG_MOUNTOPT so we can find our mdc and osc obds */
01056         lprof = class_get_profile(profilenm);
01057         if (lprof == NULL) {
01058                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x156, "The client profile '%s' could not be"
01059                                    " read from the MGS.  Does that filesystem "
01060                                    "exist?\n", profilenm);
01061                 GOTO(out_free, err = -EINVAL);
01062         }
01063         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Found profile %s: mdc=%s osc=%s\n", profilenm,
01064                lprof->lp_md, lprof->lp_dt);
01065 
01066         OBD_ALLOC(dt, strlen(lprof->lp_dt) + instlen + 2);
01067         if (!dt)
01068                 GOTO(out_free, err = -ENOMEM);
01069         sprintf(dt, "%s-%p", lprof->lp_dt, cfg->cfg_instance);
01070 
01071         OBD_ALLOC(md, strlen(lprof->lp_md) + instlen + 2);
01072         if (!md)
01073                 GOTO(out_free, err = -ENOMEM);
01074         sprintf(md, "%s-%p", lprof->lp_md, cfg->cfg_instance);
01075 
01076         /* connections, registrations, sb setup */
01077         err = client_common_fill_super(sb, md, dt, mnt);
01078         if (err < 0)
01079                 GOTO(out_free, err);
01080 
01081         sbi->ll_client_common_fill_super_succeeded = 1;
01082 
01083 out_free:
01084         if (md)
01085                 OBD_FREE(md, strlen(lprof->lp_md) + instlen + 2);
01086         if (dt)
01087                 OBD_FREE(dt, strlen(lprof->lp_dt) + instlen + 2);
01088         if (lprof != NULL)
01089                 class_put_profile(lprof);
01090         if (err)
01091                 ll_put_super(sb);
01092         else if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_VERBOSE)
01093                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Mounted %s\n", profilenm);
01094 
01095         OBD_FREE_PTR(cfg);
01096         RETURN(err);
01097 } /* ll_fill_super */
01098 
01099 void ll_put_super(struct super_block *sb)
01100 {
01101         struct config_llog_instance cfg, params_cfg;
01102         struct obd_device *obd;
01103         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01104         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
01105         char *profilenm = get_profile_name(sb);
01106         long ccc_count;
01107         int next, force = 1, rc = 0;
01108         ENTRY;
01109 
01110         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: sb %p - %s\n", sb, profilenm);
01111 
01112         cfg.cfg_instance = sb;
01113         lustre_end_log(sb, profilenm, &cfg);
01114 
01115         params_cfg.cfg_instance = sb;
01116         lustre_end_log(sb, PARAMS_FILENAME, &params_cfg);
01117 
01118         if (sbi->ll_md_exp) {
01119                 obd = class_exp2obd(sbi->ll_md_exp);
01120                 if (obd)
01121                         force = obd->obd_force;
01122         }
01123 
01124         /* Wait for unstable pages to be committed to stable storage */
01125         if (force == 0) {
01126                 struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_INTR(LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
01127                 rc = l_wait_event(sbi->ll_cache->ccc_unstable_waitq,
01128                         atomic_long_read(&sbi->ll_cache->ccc_unstable_nr) == 0,
01129                         &lwi);
01130         }
01131 
01132         ccc_count = atomic_long_read(&sbi->ll_cache->ccc_unstable_nr);
01133         if (force == 0 && rc != -EINTR)
01134                 LASSERTF(ccc_count == 0, "count: %li\n", ccc_count);
01135 
01136 
01137         /* We need to set force before the lov_disconnect in
01138            lustre_common_put_super, since l_d cleans up osc's as well. */
01139         if (force) {
01140                 next = 0;
01141                 while ((obd = class_devices_in_group(&sbi->ll_sb_uuid,
01142                                                      &next)) != NULL) {
01143                         obd->obd_force = force;
01144                 }
01145         }
01146 
01147         if (sbi->ll_client_common_fill_super_succeeded) {
01148                 /* Only if client_common_fill_super succeeded */
01149                 client_common_put_super(sb);
01150         }
01151 
01152         next = 0;
01153         while ((obd = class_devices_in_group(&sbi->ll_sb_uuid, &next)) !=NULL) {
01154                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01155         }
01156 
01157         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_VERBOSE)
01158                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Unmounted %s\n", profilenm ? profilenm : "");
01159 
01160         if (profilenm)
01161                 class_del_profile(profilenm);
01162 
01163         if (lsi->lsi_flags & LSI_BDI_INITIALIZED) {
01164                 bdi_destroy(&lsi->lsi_bdi);
01165                 lsi->lsi_flags &= ~LSI_BDI_INITIALIZED;
01166         }
01167 
01168         ll_free_sbi(sb);
01169         lsi->lsi_llsbi = NULL;
01170 
01171         lustre_common_put_super(sb);
01172 
01173         cl_env_cache_purge(~0);
01174 
01175         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
01176 
01177         EXIT;
01178 } /* client_put_super */
01179 
01180 struct inode *ll_inode_from_resource_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01181 {
01182         struct inode *inode = NULL;
01183 
01184         /* NOTE: we depend on atomic igrab() -bzzz */
01185         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01186         if (lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode) {
01187                 struct ll_inode_info * lli;
01188                 lli = ll_i2info(lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode);
01189                 if (lli->lli_inode_magic == LLI_INODE_MAGIC) {
01190                         inode = igrab(lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode);
01191                 } else {
01192                         inode = lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode;
01193                         LDLM_DEBUG_LIMIT(inode->i_state & I_FREEING ?  D_INFO :
01194                                          D_WARNING, lock, "lr_lvb_inode %p is "
01195                                          "bogus: magic %08x",
01196                                          lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode,
01197                                          lli->lli_inode_magic);
01198                         inode = NULL;
01199                 }
01200         }
01201         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01202         return inode;
01203 }
01204 
01205 void ll_dir_clear_lsm_md(struct inode *inode)
01206 {
01207         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01208 
01209         LASSERT(S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode));
01210 
01211         if (lli->lli_lsm_md != NULL) {
01212                 lmv_free_memmd(lli->lli_lsm_md);
01213                 lli->lli_lsm_md = NULL;
01214         }
01215 }
01216 
01217 static struct inode *ll_iget_anon_dir(struct super_block *sb,
01218                                       const struct lu_fid *fid,
01219                                       struct lustre_md *md)
01220 {
01221         struct ll_sb_info       *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
01222         struct mdt_body         *body = md->body;
01223         struct inode            *inode;
01224         ino_t                   ino;
01225         ENTRY;
01226 
01227         ino = cl_fid_build_ino(fid, sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_32BIT_API);
01228         inode = iget_locked(sb, ino);
01229         if (inode == NULL) {
01230                 CERROR("%s: failed get simple inode "DFID": rc = -ENOENT\n",
01231                        ll_get_fsname(sb, NULL, 0), PFID(fid));
01232                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOENT));
01233         }
01234 
01235         if (inode->i_state & I_NEW) {
01236                 struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01237                 struct lmv_stripe_md *lsm = md->lmv;
01238 
01239                 inode->i_mode = (inode->i_mode & ~S_IFMT) |
01240                                 (body->mbo_mode & S_IFMT);
01241                 LASSERTF(S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode), "Not slave inode "DFID"\n",
01242                          PFID(fid));
01243 
01244                 LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime) = 0;
01245                 LTIME_S(inode->i_atime) = 0;
01246                 LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime) = 0;
01247                 inode->i_rdev = 0;
01248 
01249 #ifdef HAVE_BACKING_DEV_INFO
01250                 /* initializing backing dev info. */
01251                 inode->i_mapping->backing_dev_info =
01252                                                 &s2lsi(inode->i_sb)->lsi_bdi;
01253 #endif
01254                 inode->i_op = &ll_dir_inode_operations;
01255                 inode->i_fop = &ll_dir_operations;
01256                 lli->lli_fid = *fid;
01257                 ll_lli_init(lli);
01258 
01259                 LASSERT(lsm != NULL);
01260                 /* master object FID */
01261                 lli->lli_pfid = body->mbo_fid1;
01262                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "lli %p slave "DFID" master "DFID"\n",
01263                        lli, PFID(fid), PFID(&lli->lli_pfid));
01264                 unlock_new_inode(inode);
01265         }
01266 
01267         RETURN(inode);
01268 }
01269 
01270 static int ll_init_lsm_md(struct inode *inode, struct lustre_md *md)
01271 {
01272         struct lu_fid *fid;
01273         struct lmv_stripe_md *lsm = md->lmv;
01274         int i;
01275 
01276         LASSERT(lsm != NULL);
01277         /* XXX sigh, this lsm_root initialization should be in
01278          * LMV layer, but it needs ll_iget right now, so we
01279          * put this here right now. */
01280         for (i = 0; i < lsm->lsm_md_stripe_count; i++) {
01281                 fid = &lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_fid;
01282                 LASSERT(lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root == NULL);
01283                 /* Unfortunately ll_iget will call ll_update_inode,
01284                  * where the initialization of slave inode is slightly
01285                  * different, so it reset lsm_md to NULL to avoid
01286                  * initializing lsm for slave inode. */
01287                 /* For migrating inode, master stripe and master object will
01288                  * be same, so we only need assign this inode */
01289                 if (lsm->lsm_md_hash_type & LMV_HASH_FLAG_MIGRATION && i == 0)
01290                         lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root = inode;
01291                 else
01292                         lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root =
01293                                 ll_iget_anon_dir(inode->i_sb, fid, md);
01294 
01295                 if (IS_ERR(lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root)) {
01296                         int rc = PTR_ERR(lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root);
01297 
01298                         lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[i].lmo_root = NULL;
01299                         return rc;
01300                 }
01301         }
01302 
01303         return 0;
01304 }
01305 
01306 static inline int lli_lsm_md_eq(const struct lmv_stripe_md *lsm_md1,
01307                                 const struct lmv_stripe_md *lsm_md2)
01308 {
01309         return lsm_md1->lsm_md_magic == lsm_md2->lsm_md_magic &&
01310                lsm_md1->lsm_md_stripe_count == lsm_md2->lsm_md_stripe_count &&
01311                lsm_md1->lsm_md_master_mdt_index ==
01312                                         lsm_md2->lsm_md_master_mdt_index &&
01313                lsm_md1->lsm_md_hash_type == lsm_md2->lsm_md_hash_type &&
01314                lsm_md1->lsm_md_layout_version ==
01315                                         lsm_md2->lsm_md_layout_version &&
01316                strcmp(lsm_md1->lsm_md_pool_name,
01317                       lsm_md2->lsm_md_pool_name) == 0;
01318 }
01319 
01320 static int ll_update_lsm_md(struct inode *inode, struct lustre_md *md)
01321 {
01322         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01323         struct lmv_stripe_md *lsm = md->lmv;
01324         int     rc;
01325         ENTRY;
01326 
01327         LASSERT(S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode));
01328         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "update lsm %p of "DFID"\n", lli->lli_lsm_md,
01329                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)));
01330 
01331         /* no striped information from request. */
01332         if (lsm == NULL) {
01333                 if (lli->lli_lsm_md == NULL) {
01334                         RETURN(0);
01335                 } else if (lli->lli_lsm_md->lsm_md_hash_type &
01336                                                 LMV_HASH_FLAG_MIGRATION) {
01337                         /* migration is done, the temporay MIGRATE layout has
01338                          * been removed */
01339                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" finish migration.\n",
01340                                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)));
01341                         lmv_free_memmd(lli->lli_lsm_md);
01342                         lli->lli_lsm_md = NULL;
01343                         RETURN(0);
01344                 } else {
01345                         /* The lustre_md from req does not include stripeEA,
01346                          * see ll_md_setattr */
01347                         RETURN(0);
01348                 }
01349         }
01350 
01351         /* set the directory layout */
01352         if (lli->lli_lsm_md == NULL) {
01353                 struct cl_attr  *attr;
01354 
01355                 rc = ll_init_lsm_md(inode, md);
01356                 if (rc != 0)
01357                         RETURN(rc);
01358 
01359                 /* set md->lmv to NULL, so the following free lustre_md
01360                  * will not free this lsm */
01361                 md->lmv = NULL;
01362                 lli->lli_lsm_md = lsm;
01363 
01364                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(attr);
01365                 if (attr == NULL)
01366                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01367 
01368                 /* validate the lsm */
01369                 rc = md_merge_attr(ll_i2mdexp(inode), lsm, attr,
01370                                    ll_md_blocking_ast);
01371                 if (rc != 0) {
01372                         OBD_FREE_PTR(attr);
01373                         RETURN(rc);
01374                 }
01375 
01376                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLNLINK)
01377                         md->body->mbo_nlink = attr->cat_nlink;
01378                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLSIZE)
01379                         md->body->mbo_size = attr->cat_size;
01380                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLATIME)
01381                         md->body->mbo_atime = attr->cat_atime;
01382                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME)
01383                         md->body->mbo_ctime = attr->cat_ctime;
01384                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME)
01385                         md->body->mbo_mtime = attr->cat_mtime;
01386 
01387                 OBD_FREE_PTR(attr);
01388 
01389                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Set lsm %p magic %x to "DFID"\n", lsm,
01390                        lsm->lsm_md_magic, PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)));
01391                 RETURN(0);
01392         }
01393 
01394         /* Compare the old and new stripe information */
01395         if (!lsm_md_eq(lli->lli_lsm_md, lsm)) {
01396                 struct lmv_stripe_md    *old_lsm = lli->lli_lsm_md;
01397                 int                     idx;
01398 
01399                 CERROR("%s: inode "DFID"(%p)'s lmv layout mismatch (%p)/(%p)"
01400                        "magic:0x%x/0x%x stripe count: %d/%d master_mdt: %d/%d"
01401                        "hash_type:0x%x/0x%x layout: 0x%x/0x%x pool:%s/%s\n",
01402                        ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), PFID(&lli->lli_fid),
01403                        inode, lsm, old_lsm,
01404                        lsm->lsm_md_magic, old_lsm->lsm_md_magic,
01405                        lsm->lsm_md_stripe_count,
01406                        old_lsm->lsm_md_stripe_count,
01407                        lsm->lsm_md_master_mdt_index,
01408                        old_lsm->lsm_md_master_mdt_index,
01409                        lsm->lsm_md_hash_type, old_lsm->lsm_md_hash_type,
01410                        lsm->lsm_md_layout_version,
01411                        old_lsm->lsm_md_layout_version,
01412                        lsm->lsm_md_pool_name,
01413                        old_lsm->lsm_md_pool_name);
01414 
01415                 for (idx = 0; idx < old_lsm->lsm_md_stripe_count; idx++) {
01416                         CERROR("%s: sub FIDs in old lsm idx %d, old: "DFID"\n",
01417                                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), idx,
01418                                PFID(&old_lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[idx].lmo_fid));
01419                 }
01420 
01421                 for (idx = 0; idx < lsm->lsm_md_stripe_count; idx++) {
01422                         CERROR("%s: sub FIDs in new lsm idx %d, new: "DFID"\n",
01423                                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), idx,
01424                                PFID(&lsm->lsm_md_oinfo[idx].lmo_fid));
01425                 }
01426 
01427                 RETURN(-EIO);
01428         }
01429 
01430         RETURN(0);
01431 }
01432 
01433 void ll_clear_inode(struct inode *inode)
01434 {
01435         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01436         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01437         ENTRY;
01438 
01439         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p)\n",
01440                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
01441 
01442         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
01443                 /* these should have been cleared in ll_file_release */
01444                 LASSERT(lli->lli_opendir_key == NULL);
01445                 LASSERT(lli->lli_sai == NULL);
01446                 LASSERT(lli->lli_opendir_pid == 0);
01447         }
01448 
01449         md_null_inode(sbi->ll_md_exp, ll_inode2fid(inode));
01450 
01451         LASSERT(!lli->lli_open_fd_write_count);
01452         LASSERT(!lli->lli_open_fd_read_count);
01453         LASSERT(!lli->lli_open_fd_exec_count);
01454 
01455         if (lli->lli_mds_write_och)
01456                 ll_md_real_close(inode, FMODE_WRITE);
01457         if (lli->lli_mds_exec_och)
01458                 ll_md_real_close(inode, FMODE_EXEC);
01459         if (lli->lli_mds_read_och)
01460                 ll_md_real_close(inode, FMODE_READ);
01461 
01462         if (S_ISLNK(inode->i_mode) && lli->lli_symlink_name) {
01463                 OBD_FREE(lli->lli_symlink_name,
01464                          strlen(lli->lli_symlink_name) + 1);
01465                 lli->lli_symlink_name = NULL;
01466         }
01467 
01468         ll_xattr_cache_destroy(inode);
01469 
01470         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT) {
01471                 LASSERT(lli->lli_posix_acl == NULL);
01472                 if (lli->lli_remote_perms) {
01473                         free_rmtperm_hash(lli->lli_remote_perms);
01474                         lli->lli_remote_perms = NULL;
01475                 }
01476         }
01477 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
01478         else if (lli->lli_posix_acl) {
01479                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&lli->lli_posix_acl->a_refcount) == 1);
01480                 LASSERT(lli->lli_remote_perms == NULL);
01481                 posix_acl_release(lli->lli_posix_acl);
01482                 lli->lli_posix_acl = NULL;
01483         }
01484 #endif
01485         lli->lli_inode_magic = LLI_INODE_DEAD;
01486 
01487         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
01488                 ll_dir_clear_lsm_md(inode);
01489         else if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) && !is_bad_inode(inode))
01490                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lli->lli_agl_list));
01491 
01492         /*
01493          * XXX This has to be done before lsm is freed below, because
01494          * cl_object still uses inode lsm.
01495          */
01496         cl_inode_fini(inode);
01497 
01498         EXIT;
01499 }
01500 
01501 static int ll_md_setattr(struct dentry *dentry, struct md_op_data *op_data)
01502 {
01503         struct lustre_md md;
01504         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
01505         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01506         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01507         int rc, ia_valid;
01508         ENTRY;
01509 
01510         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(op_data, inode, NULL, NULL, 0, 0,
01511                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01512         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01513                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01514 
01515         rc = md_setattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, NULL, 0, &request);
01516         if (rc) {
01517                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01518                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
01519                         clear_nlink(inode);
01520                         /* Unlinked special device node? Or just a race?
01521                          * Pretend we done everything. */
01522                         if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) &&
01523                             !S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
01524                                 ia_valid = op_data->op_attr.ia_valid;
01525                                 op_data->op_attr.ia_valid &= ~TIMES_SET_FLAGS;
01526                                 rc = simple_setattr(dentry, &op_data->op_attr);
01527                                 op_data->op_attr.ia_valid = ia_valid;
01528                         }
01529                 } else if (rc != -EPERM && rc != -EACCES && rc != -ETXTBSY) {
01530                         CERROR("md_setattr fails: rc = %d\n", rc);
01531                 }
01532                 RETURN(rc);
01533         }
01534 
01535         rc = md_get_lustre_md(sbi->ll_md_exp, request, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
01536                               sbi->ll_md_exp, &md);
01537         if (rc) {
01538                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01539                 RETURN(rc);
01540         }
01541 
01542         ia_valid = op_data->op_attr.ia_valid;
01543         /* inode size will be in ll_setattr_ost, can't do it now since dirty
01544          * cache is not cleared yet. */
01545         op_data->op_attr.ia_valid &= ~(TIMES_SET_FLAGS | ATTR_SIZE);
01546         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode))
01547                 mutex_lock(&inode->i_mutex);
01548         rc = simple_setattr(dentry, &op_data->op_attr);
01549         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode))
01550                 mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
01551         op_data->op_attr.ia_valid = ia_valid;
01552 
01553         rc = ll_update_inode(inode, &md);
01554         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01555 
01556         RETURN(rc);
01557 }
01558 
01559 /* If this inode has objects allocated to it (lsm != NULL), then the OST
01560  * object(s) determine the file size and mtime.  Otherwise, the MDS will
01561  * keep these values until such a time that objects are allocated for it.
01562  * We do the MDS operations first, as it is checking permissions for us.
01563  * We don't to the MDS RPC if there is nothing that we want to store there,
01564  * otherwise there is no harm in updating mtime/atime on the MDS if we are
01565  * going to do an RPC anyways.
01566  *
01567  * If we are doing a truncate, we will send the mtime and ctime updates
01568  * to the OST with the punch RPC, otherwise we do an explicit setattr RPC.
01569  * I don't believe it is possible to get e.g. ATTR_MTIME_SET and ATTR_SIZE
01570  * at the same time.
01571  *
01572  * In case of HSMimport, we only set attr on MDS.
01573  */
01574 int ll_setattr_raw(struct dentry *dentry, struct iattr *attr, bool hsm_import)
01575 {
01576         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
01577         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01578         struct md_op_data *op_data = NULL;
01579         int rc = 0;
01580         ENTRY;
01581 
01582         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "%s: setattr inode "DFID"(%p) from %llu to %llu, "
01583                "valid %x, hsm_import %d\n",
01584                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), PFID(&lli->lli_fid),
01585                inode, i_size_read(inode), attr->ia_size, attr->ia_valid,
01586                hsm_import);
01587 
01588         if (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_SIZE) {
01589                 /* Check new size against VFS/VM file size limit and rlimit */
01590                 rc = inode_newsize_ok(inode, attr->ia_size);
01591                 if (rc)
01592                         RETURN(rc);
01593 
01594                 /* The maximum Lustre file size is variable, based on the
01595                  * OST maximum object size and number of stripes.  This
01596                  * needs another check in addition to the VFS check above. */
01597                 if (attr->ia_size > ll_file_maxbytes(inode)) {
01598                         CDEBUG(D_INODE,"file "DFID" too large %llu > "LPU64"\n",
01599                                PFID(&lli->lli_fid), attr->ia_size,
01600                                ll_file_maxbytes(inode));
01601                         RETURN(-EFBIG);
01602                 }
01603 
01604                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_MTIME | ATTR_CTIME;
01605         }
01606 
01607         /* POSIX: check before ATTR_*TIME_SET set (from inode_change_ok) */
01608         if (attr->ia_valid & TIMES_SET_FLAGS) {
01609                 if ((!uid_eq(current_fsuid(), inode->i_uid)) &&
01610                     !cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_FOWNER))
01611                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01612         }
01613 
01614         /* We mark all of the fields "set" so MDS/OST does not re-set them */
01615         if (!(attr->ia_valid & ATTR_CTIME_SET) &&
01616             (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_CTIME)) {
01617                 attr->ia_ctime = CURRENT_TIME;
01618                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_CTIME_SET;
01619         }
01620         if (!(attr->ia_valid & ATTR_ATIME_SET) &&
01621             (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_ATIME)) {
01622                 attr->ia_atime = CURRENT_TIME;
01623                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_ATIME_SET;
01624         }
01625         if (!(attr->ia_valid & ATTR_MTIME_SET) &&
01626             (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_MTIME)) {
01627                 attr->ia_mtime = CURRENT_TIME;
01628                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_MTIME_SET;
01629         }
01630 
01631         if (attr->ia_valid & (ATTR_MTIME | ATTR_CTIME))
01632                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "setting mtime %lu, ctime %lu, now = %lu\n",
01633                        LTIME_S(attr->ia_mtime), LTIME_S(attr->ia_ctime),
01634                        cfs_time_current_sec());
01635 
01636         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
01637                 if (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_SIZE)
01638                         inode_dio_write_done(inode);
01639                 mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
01640         }
01641 
01642         /* We always do an MDS RPC, even if we're only changing the size;
01643          * only the MDS knows whether truncate() should fail with -ETXTBUSY */
01644 
01645         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
01646         if (op_data == NULL)
01647                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01648 
01649         if (!hsm_import && attr->ia_valid & ATTR_SIZE) {
01650                 /* If we are changing file size, file content is
01651                  * modified, flag it. */
01652                 attr->ia_valid |= MDS_OPEN_OWNEROVERRIDE;
01653                 op_data->op_bias |= MDS_DATA_MODIFIED;
01654                 ll_file_clear_flag(lli, LLIF_DATA_MODIFIED);
01655         }
01656 
01657         op_data->op_attr = *attr;
01658 
01659         rc = ll_md_setattr(dentry, op_data);
01660         if (rc)
01661                 GOTO(out, rc);
01662 
01663         if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) || hsm_import)
01664                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01665 
01666         if (attr->ia_valid & (ATTR_SIZE |
01667                               ATTR_ATIME | ATTR_ATIME_SET |
01668                               ATTR_MTIME | ATTR_MTIME_SET |
01669                               ATTR_CTIME | ATTR_CTIME_SET)) {
01670                 /* For truncate and utimes sending attributes to OSTs, setting
01671                  * mtime/atime to the past will be performed under PW [0:EOF]
01672                  * extent lock (new_size:EOF for truncate).  It may seem
01673                  * excessive to send mtime/atime updates to OSTs when not
01674                  * setting times to past, but it is necessary due to possible
01675                  * time de-synchronization between MDT inode and OST objects */
01676                 rc = cl_setattr_ost(lli->lli_clob, attr, 0);
01677         }
01678 
01679         /* If the file was restored, it needs to set dirty flag.
01680          *
01681          * We've already sent MDS_DATA_MODIFIED flag in
01682          * ll_md_setattr() for truncate. However, the MDT refuses to
01683          * set the HS_DIRTY flag on released files, so we have to set
01684          * it again if the file has been restored. Please check how
01685          * LLIF_DATA_MODIFIED is set in vvp_io_setattr_fini().
01686          *
01687          * Please notice that if the file is not released, the previous
01688          * MDS_DATA_MODIFIED has taken effect and usually
01689          * LLIF_DATA_MODIFIED is not set(see vvp_io_setattr_fini()).
01690          * This way we can save an RPC for common open + trunc
01691          * operation. */
01692         if (ll_file_test_and_clear_flag(lli, LLIF_DATA_MODIFIED)) {
01693                 struct hsm_state_set hss = {
01694                         .hss_valid = HSS_SETMASK,
01695                         .hss_setmask = HS_DIRTY,
01696                 };
01697                 int rc2;
01698 
01699                 rc2 = ll_hsm_state_set(inode, &hss);
01700                 /* truncate and write can happen at the same time, so that
01701                  * the file can be set modified even though the file is not
01702                  * restored from released state, and ll_hsm_state_set() is
01703                  * not applicable for the file, and rc2 < 0 is normal in this
01704                  * case. */
01705                 if (rc2 < 0)
01706                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, DFID "HSM set dirty failed: rc2 = %d\n",
01707                                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), rc2);
01708         }
01709 
01710         EXIT;
01711 out:
01712         if (op_data != NULL)
01713                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01714 
01715         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
01716                 mutex_lock(&inode->i_mutex);
01717                 if ((attr->ia_valid & ATTR_SIZE) && !hsm_import)
01718                         inode_dio_wait(inode);
01719         }
01720 
01721         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), (attr->ia_valid & ATTR_SIZE) ?
01722                         LPROC_LL_TRUNC : LPROC_LL_SETATTR, 1);
01723 
01724         return rc;
01725 }
01726 
01727 int ll_setattr(struct dentry *de, struct iattr *attr)
01728 {
01729         int mode = de->d_inode->i_mode;
01730 
01731         if ((attr->ia_valid & (ATTR_CTIME|ATTR_SIZE|ATTR_MODE)) ==
01732                               (ATTR_CTIME|ATTR_SIZE|ATTR_MODE))
01733                 attr->ia_valid |= MDS_OPEN_OWNEROVERRIDE;
01734 
01735         if (((attr->ia_valid & (ATTR_MODE|ATTR_FORCE|ATTR_SIZE)) ==
01736                                (ATTR_SIZE|ATTR_MODE)) &&
01737             (((mode & S_ISUID) && !(attr->ia_mode & S_ISUID)) ||
01738              (((mode & (S_ISGID|S_IXGRP)) == (S_ISGID|S_IXGRP)) &&
01739               !(attr->ia_mode & S_ISGID))))
01740                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_FORCE;
01741 
01742         if ((attr->ia_valid & ATTR_MODE) &&
01743             (mode & S_ISUID) &&
01744             !(attr->ia_mode & S_ISUID) &&
01745             !(attr->ia_valid & ATTR_KILL_SUID))
01746                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_KILL_SUID;
01747 
01748         if ((attr->ia_valid & ATTR_MODE) &&
01749             ((mode & (S_ISGID|S_IXGRP)) == (S_ISGID|S_IXGRP)) &&
01750             !(attr->ia_mode & S_ISGID) &&
01751             !(attr->ia_valid & ATTR_KILL_SGID))
01752                 attr->ia_valid |= ATTR_KILL_SGID;
01753 
01754         return ll_setattr_raw(de, attr, false);
01755 }
01756 
01757 int ll_statfs_internal(struct super_block *sb, struct obd_statfs *osfs,
01758                        __u64 max_age, __u32 flags)
01759 {
01760         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
01761         struct obd_statfs obd_osfs;
01762         int rc;
01763         ENTRY;
01764 
01765         rc = obd_statfs(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp, osfs, max_age, flags);
01766         if (rc) {
01767                 CERROR("md_statfs fails: rc = %d\n", rc);
01768                 RETURN(rc);
01769         }
01770 
01771         osfs->os_type = sb->s_magic;
01772 
01773         CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "MDC blocks "LPU64"/"LPU64" objects "LPU64"/"LPU64"\n",
01774                osfs->os_bavail, osfs->os_blocks, osfs->os_ffree,osfs->os_files);
01775 
01776         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_LAZYSTATFS)
01777                 flags |= OBD_STATFS_NODELAY;
01778 
01779         rc = obd_statfs_rqset(sbi->ll_dt_exp, &obd_osfs, max_age, flags);
01780         if (rc) {
01781                 CERROR("obd_statfs fails: rc = %d\n", rc);
01782                 RETURN(rc);
01783         }
01784 
01785         CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "OSC blocks "LPU64"/"LPU64" objects "LPU64"/"LPU64"\n",
01786                obd_osfs.os_bavail, obd_osfs.os_blocks, obd_osfs.os_ffree,
01787                obd_osfs.os_files);
01788 
01789         osfs->os_bsize = obd_osfs.os_bsize;
01790         osfs->os_blocks = obd_osfs.os_blocks;
01791         osfs->os_bfree = obd_osfs.os_bfree;
01792         osfs->os_bavail = obd_osfs.os_bavail;
01793 
01794         /* If we don't have as many objects free on the OST as inodes
01795          * on the MDS, we reduce the total number of inodes to
01796          * compensate, so that the "inodes in use" number is correct.
01797          */
01798         if (obd_osfs.os_ffree < osfs->os_ffree) {
01799                 osfs->os_files = (osfs->os_files - osfs->os_ffree) +
01800                         obd_osfs.os_ffree;
01801                 osfs->os_ffree = obd_osfs.os_ffree;
01802         }
01803 
01804         RETURN(rc);
01805 }
01806 int ll_statfs(struct dentry *de, struct kstatfs *sfs)
01807 {
01808         struct super_block *sb = de->d_sb;
01809         struct obd_statfs osfs;
01810         __u64 fsid = huge_encode_dev(sb->s_dev);
01811         int rc;
01812 
01813         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: at "LPU64" jiffies\n", get_jiffies_64());
01814         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_s2sbi(sb), LPROC_LL_STAFS, 1);
01815 
01816         /* Some amount of caching on the client is allowed */
01817         rc = ll_statfs_internal(sb, &osfs,
01818                                 cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
01819                                 0);
01820         if (rc)
01821                 return rc;
01822 
01823         statfs_unpack(sfs, &osfs);
01824 
01825         /* We need to downshift for all 32-bit kernels, because we can't
01826          * tell if the kernel is being called via sys_statfs64() or not.
01827          * Stop before overflowing f_bsize - in which case it is better
01828          * to just risk EOVERFLOW if caller is using old sys_statfs(). */
01829         if (sizeof(long) < 8) {
01830                 while (osfs.os_blocks > ~0UL && sfs->f_bsize < 0x40000000) {
01831                         sfs->f_bsize <<= 1;
01832 
01833                         osfs.os_blocks >>= 1;
01834                         osfs.os_bfree >>= 1;
01835                         osfs.os_bavail >>= 1;
01836                 }
01837         }
01838 
01839         sfs->f_blocks = osfs.os_blocks;
01840         sfs->f_bfree = osfs.os_bfree;
01841         sfs->f_bavail = osfs.os_bavail;
01842         sfs->f_fsid.val[0] = (__u32)fsid;
01843         sfs->f_fsid.val[1] = (__u32)(fsid >> 32);
01844         return 0;
01845 }
01846 
01847 void ll_inode_size_lock(struct inode *inode)
01848 {
01849         struct ll_inode_info *lli;
01850 
01851         LASSERT(!S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode));
01852 
01853         lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01854         mutex_lock(&lli->lli_size_mutex);
01855 }
01856 
01857 void ll_inode_size_unlock(struct inode *inode)
01858 {
01859         struct ll_inode_info *lli;
01860 
01861         lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01862         mutex_unlock(&lli->lli_size_mutex);
01863 }
01864 
01865 int ll_update_inode(struct inode *inode, struct lustre_md *md)
01866 {
01867         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01868         struct mdt_body *body = md->body;
01869         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01870 
01871         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLEASIZE)
01872                 cl_file_inode_init(inode, md);
01873 
01874         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
01875                 int     rc;
01876 
01877                 rc = ll_update_lsm_md(inode, md);
01878                 if (rc != 0)
01879                         return rc;
01880         }
01881 
01882         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT) {
01883                 if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM)
01884                         ll_update_remote_perm(inode, md->remote_perm);
01885         }
01886 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
01887         else if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLACL) {
01888                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_lock);
01889                 if (lli->lli_posix_acl)
01890                         posix_acl_release(lli->lli_posix_acl);
01891                 lli->lli_posix_acl = md->posix_acl;
01892                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_lock);
01893         }
01894 #endif
01895         inode->i_ino = cl_fid_build_ino(&body->mbo_fid1,
01896                                         sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_32BIT_API);
01897         inode->i_generation = cl_fid_build_gen(&body->mbo_fid1);
01898 
01899         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLATIME) {
01900                 if (body->mbo_atime > LTIME_S(inode->i_atime))
01901                         LTIME_S(inode->i_atime) = body->mbo_atime;
01902                 lli->lli_atime = body->mbo_atime;
01903         }
01904 
01905         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME) {
01906                 if (body->mbo_mtime > LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime)) {
01907                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "setting ino %lu mtime from %lu "
01908                                "to "LPU64"\n", inode->i_ino,
01909                                LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime), body->mbo_mtime);
01910                         LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime) = body->mbo_mtime;
01911                 }
01912                 lli->lli_mtime = body->mbo_mtime;
01913         }
01914 
01915         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME) {
01916                 if (body->mbo_ctime > LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime))
01917                         LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime) = body->mbo_ctime;
01918                 lli->lli_ctime = body->mbo_ctime;
01919         }
01920 
01921         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLMODE)
01922                 inode->i_mode = (inode->i_mode & S_IFMT) |
01923                                 (body->mbo_mode & ~S_IFMT);
01924 
01925         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLTYPE)
