01926                 inode->i_mode = (inode->i_mode & ~S_IFMT) |
01927                                 (body->mbo_mode & S_IFMT);
01928 
01929         LASSERT(inode->i_mode != 0);
01930         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode))
01931                 inode->i_blkbits = min(PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_BITS + 1,
01932                                        LL_MAX_BLKSIZE_BITS);
01933         else
01934                 inode->i_blkbits = inode->i_sb->s_blocksize_bits;
01935 
01936         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLUID)
01937                 inode->i_uid = make_kuid(&init_user_ns, body->mbo_uid);
01938         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLGID)
01939                 inode->i_gid = make_kgid(&init_user_ns, body->mbo_gid);
01940         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS)
01941                 inode->i_flags = ll_ext_to_inode_flags(body->mbo_flags);
01942         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLNLINK)
01943                 set_nlink(inode, body->mbo_nlink);
01944         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLRDEV)
01945                 inode->i_rdev = old_decode_dev(body->mbo_rdev);
01946 
01947         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLID) {
01948                 /* FID shouldn't be changed! */
01949                 if (fid_is_sane(&lli->lli_fid)) {
01950                         LASSERTF(lu_fid_eq(&lli->lli_fid, &body->mbo_fid1),
01951                                  "Trying to change FID "DFID
01952                                  " to the "DFID", inode "DFID"(%p)\n",
01953                                  PFID(&lli->lli_fid), PFID(&body->mbo_fid1),
01954                                  PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
01955                 } else {
01956                         lli->lli_fid = body->mbo_fid1;
01957                 }
01958         }
01959 
01960         LASSERT(fid_seq(&lli->lli_fid) != 0);
01961 
01962         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLSIZE) {
01963                 i_size_write(inode, body->mbo_size);
01964 
01965                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "inode="DFID", updating i_size %llu\n",
01966                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
01967                        (unsigned long long)body->mbo_size);
01968 
01969                 if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS)
01970                         inode->i_blocks = body->mbo_blocks;
01971         }
01972 
01973         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_TSTATE) {
01974                 /* Set LLIF_FILE_RESTORING if restore ongoing and
01975                  * clear it when done to ensure to start again
01976                  * glimpsing updated attrs
01977                  */
01978                 if (body->mbo_t_state & MS_RESTORE)
01979                         ll_file_set_flag(lli, LLIF_FILE_RESTORING);
01980                 else
01981                         ll_file_clear_flag(lli, LLIF_FILE_RESTORING);
01982         }
01983 
01984         return 0;
01985 }
01986 
01987 int ll_read_inode2(struct inode *inode, void *opaque)
01988 {
01989         struct lustre_md *md = opaque;
01990         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
01991         int     rc;
01992         ENTRY;
01993 
01994         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p)\n",
01995                PFID(&lli->lli_fid), inode);
01996 
01997         /* Core attributes from the MDS first.  This is a new inode, and
01998          * the VFS doesn't zero times in the core inode so we have to do
01999          * it ourselves.  They will be overwritten by either MDS or OST
02000          * attributes - we just need to make sure they aren't newer. */
02001         LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime) = 0;
02002         LTIME_S(inode->i_atime) = 0;
02003         LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime) = 0;
02004         inode->i_rdev = 0;
02005         rc = ll_update_inode(inode, md);
02006         if (rc != 0)
02007                 RETURN(rc);
02008 
02009         /* OIDEBUG(inode); */
02010 
02011 #ifdef HAVE_BACKING_DEV_INFO
02012         /* initializing backing dev info. */
02013         inode->i_mapping->backing_dev_info = &s2lsi(inode->i_sb)->lsi_bdi;
02014 #endif
02015         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
02016                 struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
02017                 inode->i_op = &ll_file_inode_operations;
02018                 inode->i_fop = sbi->ll_fop;
02019                 inode->i_mapping->a_ops = (struct address_space_operations *)&ll_aops;
02020                 EXIT;
02021         } else if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
02022                 inode->i_op = &ll_dir_inode_operations;
02023                 inode->i_fop = &ll_dir_operations;
02024                 EXIT;
02025         } else if (S_ISLNK(inode->i_mode)) {
02026                 inode->i_op = &ll_fast_symlink_inode_operations;
02027                 EXIT;
02028         } else {
02029                 inode->i_op = &ll_special_inode_operations;
02030 
02031                 init_special_inode(inode, inode->i_mode,
02032                                    inode->i_rdev);
02033 
02034                 EXIT;
02035         }
02036 
02037         return 0;
02038 }
02039 
02040 void ll_delete_inode(struct inode *inode)
02041 {
02042         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
02043         ENTRY;
02044 
02045         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) && lli->lli_clob != NULL)
02046                 /* It is last chance to write out dirty pages,
02047                  * otherwise we may lose data while umount */
02048                 cl_sync_file_range(inode, 0, OBD_OBJECT_EOF, CL_FSYNC_LOCAL, 1);
02049 
02050         truncate_inode_pages_final(&inode->i_data);
02051 
02052         LASSERTF(inode->i_data.nrpages == 0, "inode="DFID"(%p) nrpages=%lu, "
02053                  "see https://jira.hpdd.intel.com/browse/LU-118\n",
02054                  PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, inode->i_data.nrpages);
02055 
02056 #ifdef HAVE_SBOPS_EVICT_INODE
02057         ll_clear_inode(inode);
02058 #endif
02059         clear_inode(inode);
02060 
02061         EXIT;
02062 }
02063 
02064 int ll_iocontrol(struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
02065                  unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
02066 {
02067         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
02068         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
02069         int rc, flags = 0;
02070         ENTRY;
02071 
02072         switch(cmd) {
02073         case FSFILT_IOC_GETFLAGS: {
02074                 struct mdt_body *body;
02075                 struct md_op_data *op_data;
02076 
02077                 op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, NULL, NULL,
02078                                              0, 0, LUSTRE_OPC_ANY,
02079                                              NULL);
02080                 if (IS_ERR(op_data))
02081                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
02082 
02083                 op_data->op_valid = OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
02084                 rc = md_getattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &req);
02085                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
02086                 if (rc) {
02087                         CERROR("%s: failure inode "DFID": rc = %d\n",
02088                                sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_obd->obd_name,
02089                                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), rc);
02090                         RETURN(-abs(rc));
02091                 }
02092 
02093                 body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
02094 
02095                 flags = body->mbo_flags;
02096 
02097                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02098 
02099                 RETURN(put_user(flags, (int __user *)arg));
02100         }
02101         case FSFILT_IOC_SETFLAGS: {
02102                 struct iattr *attr;
02103                 struct md_op_data *op_data;
02104                 struct cl_object *obj;
02105 
02106                 if (get_user(flags, (int __user *)arg))
02107                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
02108 
02109                 op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, NULL, NULL, 0, 0,
02110                                              LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
02111                 if (IS_ERR(op_data))
02112                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
02113 
02114                 op_data->op_attr_flags = flags;
02115                 op_data->op_attr.ia_valid |= ATTR_ATTR_FLAG;
02116                 rc = md_setattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, NULL, 0, &req);
02117                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
02118                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02119                 if (rc)
02120                         RETURN(rc);
02121 
02122                 inode->i_flags = ll_ext_to_inode_flags(flags);
02123 
02124                 obj = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
02125                 if (obj == NULL)
02126                         RETURN(0);
02127 
02128                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(attr);
02129                 if (attr == NULL)
02130                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02131 
02132                 attr->ia_valid = ATTR_ATTR_FLAG;
02133                 rc = cl_setattr_ost(obj, attr, flags);
02134 
02135                 OBD_FREE_PTR(attr);
02136                 RETURN(rc);
02137         }
02138         default:
02139                 RETURN(-ENOSYS);
02140         }
02141 
02142         RETURN(0);
02143 }
02144 
02145 int ll_flush_ctx(struct inode *inode)
02146 {
02147         struct ll_sb_info  *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
02148 
02149         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "flush context for user %d\n",
02150                from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_uid()));
02151 
02152         obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp,
02153                            sizeof(KEY_FLUSH_CTX), KEY_FLUSH_CTX,
02154                            0, NULL, NULL);
02155         obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
02156                            sizeof(KEY_FLUSH_CTX), KEY_FLUSH_CTX,
02157                            0, NULL, NULL);
02158         return 0;
02159 }
02160 
02161 /* umount -f client means force down, don't save state */
02162 void ll_umount_begin(struct super_block *sb)
02163 {
02164         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
02165         struct obd_device *obd;
02166         struct obd_ioctl_data *ioc_data;
02167         ENTRY;
02168 
02169         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: superblock %p count %d active %d\n", sb,
02170                sb->s_count, atomic_read(&sb->s_active));
02171 
02172         obd = class_exp2obd(sbi->ll_md_exp);
02173         if (obd == NULL) {
02174                 CERROR("Invalid MDC connection handle "LPX64"\n",
02175                        sbi->ll_md_exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
02176                 EXIT;
02177                 return;
02178         }
02179         obd->obd_force = 1;
02180 
02181         obd = class_exp2obd(sbi->ll_dt_exp);
02182         if (obd == NULL) {
02183                 CERROR("Invalid LOV connection handle "LPX64"\n",
02184                        sbi->ll_dt_exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
02185                 EXIT;
02186                 return;
02187         }
02188         obd->obd_force = 1;
02189 
02190         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ioc_data);
02191         if (ioc_data) {
02192                 obd_iocontrol(IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE, sbi->ll_md_exp,
02193                               sizeof *ioc_data, ioc_data, NULL);
02194 
02195                 obd_iocontrol(IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
02196                               sizeof *ioc_data, ioc_data, NULL);
02197 
02198                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ioc_data);
02199         }
02200 
02201         /* Really, we'd like to wait until there are no requests outstanding,
02202          * and then continue.  For now, we just invalidate the requests,
02203          * schedule() and sleep one second if needed, and hope.
02204          */
02205         schedule();
02206         EXIT;
02207 }
02208 
02209 int ll_remount_fs(struct super_block *sb, int *flags, char *data)
02210 {
02211         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
02212         char *profilenm = get_profile_name(sb);
02213         int err;
02214         __u32 read_only;
02215 
02216         if ((*flags & MS_RDONLY) != (sb->s_flags & MS_RDONLY)) {
02217                 read_only = *flags & MS_RDONLY;
02218                 err = obd_set_info_async(NULL, sbi->ll_md_exp,
02219                                          sizeof(KEY_READ_ONLY),
02220                                          KEY_READ_ONLY, sizeof(read_only),
02221                                          &read_only, NULL);
02222                 if (err) {
02223                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Failed to remount %s %s (%d)\n",
02224                                       profilenm, read_only ?
02225                                       "read-only" : "read-write", err);
02226                         return err;
02227                 }
02228 
02229                 if (read_only)
02230                         sb->s_flags |= MS_RDONLY;
02231                 else
02232                         sb->s_flags &= ~MS_RDONLY;
02233 
02234                 if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_VERBOSE)
02235                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Remounted %s %s\n", profilenm,
02236                                       read_only ?  "read-only" : "read-write");
02237         }
02238         return 0;
02239 }
02240 
02256 void ll_open_cleanup(struct super_block *sb, struct ptlrpc_request *open_req)
02257 {
02258         struct mdt_body                 *body;
02259         struct md_op_data               *op_data;
02260         struct ptlrpc_request           *close_req = NULL;
02261         struct obd_export               *exp       = ll_s2sbi(sb)->ll_md_exp;
02262         ENTRY;
02263 
02264         body = req_capsule_server_get(&open_req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
02265         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
02266         if (op_data == NULL) {
02267                 CWARN("%s: cannot allocate op_data to release open handle for "
02268                       DFID"\n",
02269                       ll_get_fsname(sb, NULL, 0), PFID(&body->mbo_fid1));
02270 
02271                 RETURN_EXIT;
02272         }
02273 
02274         op_data->op_fid1 = body->mbo_fid1;
02275         op_data->op_handle = body->mbo_handle;
02276         op_data->op_mod_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
02277         md_close(exp, op_data, NULL, &close_req);
02278         ptlrpc_req_finished(close_req);
02279         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
02280 
02281         EXIT;
02282 }
02283 
02284 int ll_prep_inode(struct inode **inode, struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02285                   struct super_block *sb, struct lookup_intent *it)
02286 {
02287         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = NULL;
02288         struct lustre_md md = { NULL };
02289         int rc;
02290         ENTRY;
02291 
02292         LASSERT(*inode || sb);
02293         sbi = sb ? ll_s2sbi(sb) : ll_i2sbi(*inode);
02294         rc = md_get_lustre_md(sbi->ll_md_exp, req, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
02295                               sbi->ll_md_exp, &md);
02296         if (rc != 0)
02297                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
02298 
02299         if (*inode) {
02300                 rc = ll_update_inode(*inode, &md);
02301                 if (rc != 0)
02302                         GOTO(out, rc);
02303         } else {
02304                 LASSERT(sb != NULL);
02305 
02306                 /*
02307                  * At this point server returns to client's same fid as client
02308                  * generated for creating. So using ->fid1 is okay here.
02309                  */
02310                 LASSERT(fid_is_sane(&md.body->mbo_fid1));
02311 
02312                 *inode = ll_iget(sb, cl_fid_build_ino(&md.body->mbo_fid1,
02313                                              sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_32BIT_API),
02314                                  &md);
02315                 if (IS_ERR(*inode)) {
02316 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
02317                         if (md.posix_acl) {
02318                                 posix_acl_release(md.posix_acl);
02319                                 md.posix_acl = NULL;
02320                         }
02321 #endif
02322                         rc = IS_ERR(*inode) ? PTR_ERR(*inode) : -ENOMEM;
02323                         *inode = NULL;
02324                         CERROR("new_inode -fatal: rc %d\n", rc);
02325                         GOTO(out, rc);
02326                 }
02327         }
02328 
02329         /* Handling piggyback layout lock.
02330          * Layout lock can be piggybacked by getattr and open request.
02331          * The lsm can be applied to inode only if it comes with a layout lock
02332          * otherwise correct layout may be overwritten, for example:
02333          * 1. proc1: mdt returns a lsm but not granting layout
02334          * 2. layout was changed by another client
02335          * 3. proc2: refresh layout and layout lock granted
02336          * 4. proc1: to apply a stale layout */
02337         if (it != NULL && it->it_lock_mode != 0) {
02338                 struct lustre_handle lockh;
02339                 struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02340 
02341                 lockh.cookie = it->it_lock_handle;
02342                 lock = ldlm_handle2lock(&lockh);
02343                 LASSERT(lock != NULL);
02344                 if (ldlm_has_layout(lock)) {
02345                         struct cl_object_conf conf;
02346 
02347                         memset(&conf, 0, sizeof(conf));
02348                         conf.coc_opc = OBJECT_CONF_SET;
02349                         conf.coc_inode = *inode;
02350                         conf.coc_lock = lock;
02351                         conf.u.coc_layout = md.layout;
02352                         (void)ll_layout_conf(*inode, &conf);
02353                 }
02354                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02355         }
02356 
02357         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02358 
02359 out:
02360         md_free_lustre_md(sbi->ll_md_exp, &md);
02361 
02362 cleanup:
02363         if (rc != 0 && it != NULL && it->it_op & IT_OPEN)
02364                 ll_open_cleanup(sb != NULL ? sb : (*inode)->i_sb, req);
02365 
02366         return rc;
02367 }
02368 
02369 int ll_obd_statfs(struct inode *inode, void __user *arg)
02370 {
02371         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = NULL;
02372         struct obd_export *exp;
02373         char *buf = NULL;
02374         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = NULL;
02375         __u32 type;
02376         int len = 0, rc;
02377 
02378         if (!inode || !(sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode)))
02379                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc = -EINVAL);
02380 
02381         rc = obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, arg);
02382         if (rc)
02383                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc);
02384 
02385         data = (void*)buf;
02386         if (!data->ioc_inlbuf1 || !data->ioc_inlbuf2 ||
02387             !data->ioc_pbuf1 || !data->ioc_pbuf2)
02388                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc = -EINVAL);
02389 
02390         if (data->ioc_inllen1 != sizeof(__u32) ||
02391             data->ioc_inllen2 != sizeof(__u32) ||
02392             data->ioc_plen1 != sizeof(struct obd_statfs) ||
02393             data->ioc_plen2 != sizeof(struct obd_uuid))
02394                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc = -EINVAL);
02395 
02396         memcpy(&type, data->ioc_inlbuf1, sizeof(__u32));
02397         if (type & LL_STATFS_LMV)
02398                 exp = sbi->ll_md_exp;
02399         else if (type & LL_STATFS_LOV)
02400                 exp = sbi->ll_dt_exp;
02401         else
02402                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc = -ENODEV);
02403 
02404         rc = obd_iocontrol(IOC_OBD_STATFS, exp, len, buf, NULL);
02405         if (rc)
02406                 GOTO(out_statfs, rc);
02407 out_statfs:
02408         if (buf)
02409                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
02410         return rc;
02411 }
02412 
02413 int ll_process_config(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
02414 {
02415         struct super_block *sb;
02416         unsigned long x;
02417         int rc = 0;
02418         char *ptr;
02419 
02420         /* The instance name contains the sb: lustre-client-aacfe000 */
02421         ptr = strrchr(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), '-');
02422         if (!ptr || !*(++ptr))
02423                 return -EINVAL;
02424         if (sscanf(ptr, "%lx", &x) != 1)
02425                 return -EINVAL;
02426         sb = (struct super_block *)x;
02427         /* This better be a real Lustre superblock! */
02428         LASSERT(s2lsi(sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_magic == LMD_MAGIC);
02429 
02430         /* Note we have not called client_common_fill_super yet, so
02431            proc fns must be able to handle that! */
02432         rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_LLITE, lprocfs_llite_obd_vars,
02433                                       lcfg, sb);
02434         if (rc > 0)
02435                 rc = 0;
02436         return rc;
02437 }
02438 
02439 /* this function prepares md_op_data hint for passing it down to MD stack. */
02440 struct md_op_data *ll_prep_md_op_data(struct md_op_data *op_data,
02441                                       struct inode *i1, struct inode *i2,
02442                                       const char *name, size_t namelen,
02443                                       __u32 mode, __u32 opc, void *data)
02444 {
02445         LASSERT(i1 != NULL);
02446 
02447         if (name == NULL) {
02448                 /* Do not reuse namelen for something else. */
02449                 if (namelen != 0)
02450                         return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
02451         } else {
02452                 if (namelen > ll_i2sbi(i1)->ll_namelen)
02453                         return ERR_PTR(-ENAMETOOLONG);
02454 
02455                 if (!lu_name_is_valid_2(name, namelen))
02456                         return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
02457         }
02458 
02459         if (op_data == NULL)
02460                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
02461 
02462         if (op_data == NULL)
02463                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
02464 
02465         ll_i2gids(op_data->op_suppgids, i1, i2);
02466         op_data->op_fid1 = *ll_inode2fid(i1);
02467         op_data->op_default_stripe_offset = -1;
02468         if (S_ISDIR(i1->i_mode)) {
02469                 op_data->op_mea1 = ll_i2info(i1)->lli_lsm_md;
02470                 if (opc == LUSTRE_OPC_MKDIR)
02471                         op_data->op_default_stripe_offset =
02472                                    ll_i2info(i1)->lli_def_stripe_offset;
02473         }
02474 
02475         if (i2) {
02476                 op_data->op_fid2 = *ll_inode2fid(i2);
02477                 if (S_ISDIR(i2->i_mode))
02478                         op_data->op_mea2 = ll_i2info(i2)->lli_lsm_md;
02479         } else {
02480                 fid_zero(&op_data->op_fid2);
02481         }
02482 
02483         if (ll_i2sbi(i1)->ll_flags & LL_SBI_64BIT_HASH)
02484                 op_data->op_cli_flags |= CLI_HASH64;
02485 
02486         if (ll_need_32bit_api(ll_i2sbi(i1)))
02487                 op_data->op_cli_flags |= CLI_API32;
02488 
02489         op_data->op_name = name;
02490         op_data->op_namelen = namelen;
02491         op_data->op_mode = mode;
02492         op_data->op_mod_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
02493         op_data->op_fsuid = from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_fsuid());
02494         op_data->op_fsgid = from_kgid(&init_user_ns, current_fsgid());
02495         op_data->op_cap = cfs_curproc_cap_pack();
02496         if ((opc == LUSTRE_OPC_CREATE) && (name != NULL) &&
02497              filename_is_volatile(name, namelen, &op_data->op_mds)) {
02498                 op_data->op_bias |= MDS_CREATE_VOLATILE;
02499         } else {
02500                 op_data->op_mds = 0;
02501         }
02502         op_data->op_data = data;
02503 
02504         return op_data;
02505 }
02506 
02507 void ll_finish_md_op_data(struct md_op_data *op_data)
02508 {
02509         OBD_FREE_PTR(op_data);
02510 }
02511 
02512 #ifdef HAVE_SUPEROPS_USE_DENTRY
02513 int ll_show_options(struct seq_file *seq, struct dentry *dentry)
02514 #else
02515 int ll_show_options(struct seq_file *seq, struct vfsmount *vfs)
02516 #endif
02517 {
02518         struct ll_sb_info *sbi;
02519 
02520 #ifdef HAVE_SUPEROPS_USE_DENTRY
02521         LASSERT((seq != NULL) && (dentry != NULL));
02522         sbi = ll_s2sbi(dentry->d_sb);
02523 #else
02524         LASSERT((seq != NULL) && (vfs != NULL));
02525         sbi = ll_s2sbi(vfs->mnt_sb);
02526 #endif
02527 
02528         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_NOLCK)
02529                 seq_puts(seq, ",nolock");
02530 
02531         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_FLOCK)
02532                 seq_puts(seq, ",flock");
02533 
02534         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_LOCALFLOCK)
02535                 seq_puts(seq, ",localflock");
02536 
02537         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_XATTR)
02538                 seq_puts(seq, ",user_xattr");
02539 
02540         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_LAZYSTATFS)
02541                 seq_puts(seq, ",lazystatfs");
02542 
02543         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_FID2PATH)
02544                 seq_puts(seq, ",user_fid2path");
02545 
02546         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_ALWAYS_PING)
02547                 seq_puts(seq, ",always_ping");
02548 
02549         RETURN(0);
02550 }
02551 
02555 int ll_get_obd_name(struct inode *inode, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
02556 {
02557         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
02558         struct obd_device *obd;
02559         ENTRY;
02560 
02561         if (cmd == OBD_IOC_GETDTNAME)
02562                 obd = class_exp2obd(sbi->ll_dt_exp);
02563         else if (cmd == OBD_IOC_GETMDNAME)
02564                 obd = class_exp2obd(sbi->ll_md_exp);
02565         else
02566                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02567 
02568         if (!obd)
02569                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
02570 
02571         if (copy_to_user((void __user *)arg, obd->obd_name,
02572                          strlen(obd->obd_name) + 1))
02573                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02574 
02575         RETURN(0);
02576 }
02577 
02583 char *ll_get_fsname(struct super_block *sb, char *buf, int buflen)
02584 {
02585         static char fsname_static[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
02586         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
02587         char *ptr;
02588         int len;
02589 
02590         if (buf == NULL) {
02591                 /* this means the caller wants to use static buffer
02592                  * and it doesn't care about race. Usually this is
02593                  * in error reporting path */
02594                 buf = fsname_static;
02595                 buflen = sizeof(fsname_static);
02596         }
02597 
02598         len = strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile);
02599         ptr = strrchr(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile, '-');
02600         if (ptr && (strcmp(ptr, "-client") == 0))
02601                 len -= 7;
02602 
02603         if (unlikely(len >= buflen))
02604                 len = buflen - 1;
02605         strncpy(buf, lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile, len);
02606         buf[len] = '\0';
02607 
02608         return buf;
02609 }
02610 
02611 static char* ll_d_path(struct dentry *dentry, char *buf, int bufsize)
02612 {
02613         char *path = NULL;
02614 
02615         struct path p;
02616 
02617         p.dentry = dentry;
02618         p.mnt = current->fs->root.mnt;
02619         path_get(&p);
02620         path = d_path(&p, buf, bufsize);
02621         path_put(&p);
02622         return path;
02623 }
02624 
02625 void ll_dirty_page_discard_warn(struct page *page, int ioret)
02626 {
02627         char *buf, *path = NULL;
02628         struct dentry *dentry = NULL;
02629         struct inode *inode = page->mapping->host;
02630 
02631         /* this can be called inside spin lock so use GFP_ATOMIC. */
02632         buf = (char *)__get_free_page(GFP_ATOMIC);
02633         if (buf != NULL) {
02634                 dentry = d_find_alias(page->mapping->host);
02635                 if (dentry != NULL)
02636                         path = ll_d_path(dentry, buf, PAGE_SIZE);
02637         }
02638 
02639         CDEBUG(D_WARNING,
02640                "%s: dirty page discard: %s/fid: "DFID"/%s may get corrupted "
02641                "(rc %d)\n", ll_get_fsname(page->mapping->host->i_sb, NULL, 0),
02642                s2lsi(page->mapping->host->i_sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev,
02643                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
02644                (path && !IS_ERR(path)) ? path : "", ioret);
02645 
02646         if (dentry != NULL)
02647                 dput(dentry);
02648 
02649         if (buf != NULL)
02650                 free_page((unsigned long)buf);
02651 }
02652 
02653 ssize_t ll_copy_user_md(const struct lov_user_md __user *md,
02654                         struct lov_user_md **kbuf)
02655 {
02656         struct lov_user_md      lum;
02657         ssize_t                 lum_size;
02658         ENTRY;
02659 
02660         if (copy_from_user(&lum, md, sizeof(lum)))
02661                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02662 
02663         lum_size = ll_lov_user_md_size(&lum);
02664         if (lum_size < 0)
02665                 RETURN(lum_size);
02666 
02667         OBD_ALLOC(*kbuf, lum_size);
02668         if (*kbuf == NULL)
02669                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02670 
02671         if (copy_from_user(*kbuf, md, lum_size) != 0) {
02672                 OBD_FREE(*kbuf, lum_size);
02673                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02674         }
02675 
02676         RETURN(lum_size);
02677 }
02678 
02679 /*
02680  * Compute llite root squash state after a change of root squash
02681  * configuration setting or add/remove of a lnet nid
02682  */
02683 void ll_compute_rootsquash_state(struct ll_sb_info *sbi)
02684 {
02685         struct root_squash_info *squash = &sbi->ll_squash;
02686         int i;
02687         bool matched;
02688         lnet_process_id_t id;
02689 
02690         /* Update norootsquash flag */
02691         down_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02692         if (list_empty(&squash->rsi_nosquash_nids))
02693                 sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_NOROOTSQUASH;
02694         else {
02695                 /* Do not apply root squash as soon as one of our NIDs is
02696                  * in the nosquash_nids list */
02697                 matched = false;
02698                 i = 0;
02699                 while (LNetGetId(i++, &id) != -ENOENT) {
02700                         if (LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(id.nid)) == LOLND)
02701                                 continue;
02702                         if (cfs_match_nid(id.nid, &squash->rsi_nosquash_nids)) {
02703                                 matched = true;
02704                                 break;
02705                         }
02706                 }
02707                 if (matched)
02708                         sbi->ll_flags |= LL_SBI_NOROOTSQUASH;
02709                 else
02710                         sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_NOROOTSQUASH;
02711         }
02712         up_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02713 }
02714 
02726 static int ll_linkea_decode(struct linkea_data *ldata, unsigned int linkno,
02727                             struct lu_fid *parent_fid, struct lu_name *ln)
02728 {
02729         unsigned int    idx;
02730         int             rc;
02731         ENTRY;
02732 
02733         rc = linkea_init(ldata);
02734         if (rc < 0)
02735                 RETURN(rc);
02736 
02737         if (linkno >= ldata->ld_leh->leh_reccount)
02738                 /* beyond last link */
02739                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
02740 
02741         linkea_first_entry(ldata);
02742         for (idx = 0; ldata->ld_lee != NULL; idx++) {
02743                 linkea_entry_unpack(ldata->ld_lee, &ldata->ld_reclen, ln,
02744                                     parent_fid);
02745                 if (idx == linkno)
02746                         break;
02747 
02748                 linkea_next_entry(ldata);
02749         }
02750 
02751         if (idx < linkno)
02752                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
02753 
02754         RETURN(0);
02755 }
02756 
02770 int ll_getparent(struct file *file, struct getparent __user *arg)
02771 {
02772         struct dentry           *dentry = file->f_path.dentry;
02773         struct inode            *inode = dentry->d_inode;
02774         struct linkea_data      *ldata;
02775         struct lu_buf            buf = LU_BUF_NULL;
02776         struct lu_name           ln;
02777         struct lu_fid            parent_fid;
02778         __u32                    linkno;
02779         __u32                    name_size;
02780         int                      rc;
02781 
02782         ENTRY;
02783 
02784         if (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH) &&
02785             !(ll_i2sbi(inode)->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_FID2PATH))
02786                 RETURN(-EPERM);
02787 
02788         if (get_user(name_size, &arg->gp_name_size))
02789                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02790 
02791         if (get_user(linkno, &arg->gp_linkno))
02792                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02793 
02794         if (name_size > PATH_MAX)
02795                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02796 
02797         OBD_ALLOC(ldata, sizeof(*ldata));
02798         if (ldata == NULL)
02799                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02800 
02801         rc = linkea_data_new(ldata, &buf);
02802         if (rc < 0)
02803                 GOTO(ldata_free, rc);
02804 
02805         rc = ll_getxattr(dentry, XATTR_NAME_LINK, buf.lb_buf, buf.lb_len);
02806         if (rc < 0)
02807                 GOTO(lb_free, rc);
02808 
02809         rc = ll_linkea_decode(ldata, linkno, &parent_fid, &ln);
02810         if (rc < 0)
02811                 GOTO(lb_free, rc);
02812 
02813         if (ln.ln_namelen >= name_size)
02814                 GOTO(lb_free, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
02815 
02816         if (copy_to_user(&arg->gp_fid, &parent_fid, sizeof(arg->gp_fid)))
02817                 GOTO(lb_free, rc = -EFAULT);
02818 
02819         if (copy_to_user(&arg->gp_name, ln.ln_name, ln.ln_namelen))
02820                 GOTO(lb_free, rc = -EFAULT);
02821 
02822         if (put_user('\0', arg->gp_name + ln.ln_namelen))
02823                 GOTO(lb_free, rc = -EFAULT);
02824 
02825 lb_free:
02826         lu_buf_free(&buf);
02827 ldata_free:
02828         OBD_FREE(ldata, sizeof(*ldata));
02829 
02830         RETURN(rc);
02831 }
